issues.body:
## Problem Description

I'm following the code example in [github_tools.py](https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/cookbook/tools/github_tools.py).
Currently GithubTools does not have proxy parameter, and executing it will resulted in error with company network:

```markdown
DEBUG HTTPSConnectionPool(host='api.github.com', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /repos/agno-agi/agno (Caused by         
      ConnectTimeoutError(<urllib3.connection.HTTPSConnection object at 0x00000234AEC30A50>, 'Connection to api.github.com timed    
      out. (connect timeout=15)'))    
```

Whereas other Tools have proxies parameter:

```py
agent_with_youtube_tools = Agent(
    tools=[YouTubeTools(proxies=proxies)],
    ...
)

agent_with_duckduckgo_tools = Agent(
    tools=[DuckDuckGoTools(proxies=proxies)],
    ...
)
```

GitHubTools does not have proxies parameter:
```py
agent_with_github_tools = Agent(
    tools=[GithubTools(proxies=proxies)], # will resulted in error `TypeError: Toolkit.__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'proxy'`
    ...
)
```

## Proposed Solution
Enable proxy feature for GitHubTools

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add GitHub models
issues.body:
## Problem Description
I often find it frustrating when experimenting with AI models for quick proof‚Äëof‚Äëconcepts because many hosted model providers require paid subscriptions or have restrictive rate limits. This creates a barrier for rapid prototyping and evaluation of different architectures.

## Proposed Solution
Integrate GitHub Marketplace Models (https://github.com/marketplace/models) as an optional provider in our AI framework. These models are free to use and can be accessed directly via GitHub‚Äôs APIs. The feature would allow users to:
- Browse available GitHub models from within our UI or CLI
- Select a model and pull it into their workspace with a single command
- Configure authentication (using GitHub tokens) seamlessly
- Fall back to existing providers if a GitHub model isn‚Äôt available or suitable

## Alternatives Considered
- **Hugging Face free tier**: good selection but still rate‚Äëlimited and requires separate account setup.  
- **Local open‚Äësource models**: eliminates cost but demands heavy local compute and complex environment setup.  
- **Paid API keys (OpenAI, Azure, etc.)**: easy integration but incurs costs and isn‚Äôt ideal for quick demos.

## Would you like to work on this?
**[ ] Yes, I‚Äôd love to work on it!**
**[ x ] I‚Äôm open to collaborating but need guidance.**
**[ ] No, I‚Äôm just sharing the idea.**

issues.title: [Feature Request] Multi-Agent Patterns Enhancement
issues.body: ## Problem Description I found the Agent Team API can not handle complicated workflow and Hierarchical, currently agent team is only instructions. Key Patterns like - Orchestrator-worker pattern - Hierarchical agent pattern - Blackboard pattern - Market-based pattern ## Proposed Solution Enhance the Multi agents design pattern, rethinking from existing market implementation. - AutoGen based queue system https://microsoft.github.io/autogen/stable/user-guide/core-user-guide/design-patterns/concurrent-agents.html - Langraph based network graph https://networkx.org/documentation/stable/tutorial.html - CrewAI does not support advanced pattern only Sequential, Hierarchical, Consensual Process (Planned) https://docs.crewai.com/concepts/processes I recommend system implement base on event driven like autogen, it is much easy to adapt into distribution system with existing tools like message system https://www.confluent.io/blog/event-driven-multi-agent-systems/ ## Alternatives Considered using external message bus like kafka, agent listen on these topics. agno system can cross clouds providers, legacy system to integrate together. https://medium.com/data-science-collective/agentic-mesh-patterns-for-an-agent-ecosystem-ef13469b7cf7 ## Additional context Include any extra information that might be helpful, such as: ## Would you like to work on this? We welcome contributions! issues.title: [Bug] FirecrawlTools incompatible with the current Firecrawl API.
issues.body:
# Description
The `FirecrawlTools` class in agno 1.3.3 is incompatible with the current Firecrawl API. When attempting to use the `scrape_website` function, it fails with a 400 Bad Request error because of the use of a `params` key in the request body, which is no longer accepted by the Firecrawl API.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Install agno version 1.3.3
2. Install the latest firecrawl-py library
3. Create a FirecrawlTools instance with `scrape=True`
4. Call the `scrape_website` function with a URL
5. Observe the 400 Bad Request error

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```python
from agno.tools.firecrawl import FirecrawlTools

# Initialize FirecrawlTools with scrape=True
firecrawl_tools = FirecrawlTools(scrape=True, crawl=False)

# Try to scrape a URL
result = firecrawl_tools.scrape_website(url="https://example.com/file.csv")
```

## Expected Behavior
The `scrape_website` function should successfully scrape the provided URL and return the contents.

## Actual Behavior
The function fails with the following error:
```
Unexpected error during scrape URL: Status code 400. Bad Request - [{'code': 'unrecognized_keys', 'keys': ['params'], 'path': [], 'message': 'Unrecognized key in body -- please review the v1 API documentation for request body changes'}]
```

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
```
WARNING  Could not run function scrape_website(url=...)                         
ERROR    Unexpected error during scrape URL: Status code 400. Bad Request -     
         [{'code': 'unrecognized_keys', 'keys': ['params'], 'path': [],         
         'message': 'Unrecognized key in body -- please review the v1 API       
         documentation for request body changes'}]                              
         Traceback (most recent call last):                                     
           File                                                                 
         "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.11.12/x64/lib/python3.11/site-packages/a
         gno/tools/function.py", line 475, in execute                           
```

## Environment
- OS: macOS/Linux (Docker container)
- Agno Version: 1.3.3
- External Dependency Versions: firecrawl-py (2.1.1)
- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.11

## Possible Solutions (optional)
The issue is in the `scrape_website` method in `firecrawl.py` where it calls `scrape_url` with a named parameter:

```python
# Line 71 in agno/tools/firecrawl.py
scrape_result = self.app.scrape_url(url, params=params)
```

The Firecrawl SDK and API expect the parameters to be passed directly, not in a "params" key. This line should be changed to:

```python
scrape_result = self.app.scrape_url(url, params)
```

issues.title: [Bug] Redundant message history storage
issues.body: # Description When set to use storage to create memories, summaries, etc agno tends to keep redundant copies of chat history leading to bloated storage and inefficient/slow response ## Steps to Reproduce Create an agent using all the storage features, have a lengthy chat and examine the agent sessions storage database entry. ## Agent Configuration (if applicable) I'm using an agent with firestore storage for a nosql experience. I noticed this when firestore complained about the document being over the limit for firestore. ``` # agno chat agent chat_agent = Agent( telemetry=False, monitoring=False, user_id="unknown", model=model_pro, storage=FirestoreStorage( collection_name="agent_sessions", ), # Store memories in Firestore memory=AgentMemory( db=FirestoreMemoryDb(), create_user_memories=True, create_session_summary=True, update_user_memories_after_run=True, update_session_summary_after_run=True, classifier=MemoryClassifier(model=model_flash), summarizer=MemorySummarizer(model=model_flash), manager=MemoryManager(model=model_flash), ), # Set add_history_to_messages=true to add the previous chat history to the messages sent to the Model. add_history_to_messages=True, # Number of historical responses to add to the messages. num_history_responses=30, read_chat_history=True, create_default_user_message=False, retries=3, instructions=chat_agent_instructions, additional_context=more_stuff, markdown=True, ) ``` ## Expected Behavior I would expect agno to store a single copy of the messages in the chat and reference it when referring to the history. ## Actual Behavior Agno appears to store: - memory.messages that holds a current record of the conversation - memory.runs.response.messages that also holds a record of the conversation for each run of the agent When adding past conversation to the chat history; agno appears to use the latter and relies on the "from_history" field to weed out every copy of messages in all the runs to produce the same thing that the memory.messages list already holds. https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/memory/agent.py#L134 ## Possible Solutions (optional) I would think that: - memory.runs would not store message history - references to the chat history would only use the existing memory.messages list ## Additional Context This is particularly expensive when there are lengthy system instructions involved which are stored multiple times for each time the agent is run even though they aren't referenced.
issues.author: jeffbryner

comments.author: jeffbryner
comments.body: Also a little confusing that the num_history_responses parameter appears to mean how many messages you'd like to add to the chat history, but it actually controls how many 'runs' are considered. The number of runs doesn't impact the number of messages added to the history, since the entire history i

issues.body:
Hi team,

This isn‚Äôt a bug or feature request ‚Äî I‚Äôm looking for guidance on the best way to use Agno for a batch processing use case.

I‚Äôm using a multi-agent setup to run research tasks and return structured outputs. I‚Äôd like to parallelize requests for speed, while respecting rate limits (e.g., OpenAI, Jina Reader). Are there any recommended patterns or best practices for this?

I understand this may be outside the scope of the SDK, but I imagine it‚Äôs a common use case across industries. If your team has explored this ‚Äî especially in a serverless or containerized environment like AWS Lambda ‚Äî I‚Äôd love to hear your insights.
issues.author: mancunian1792

issues.title: [Bug] Async tool calls not working with Agno
issues.body:
# Description
I am unable to use async tools with Agno as they are not being awaited properly.

## Steps to Reproduce
We can run the example code to reproduce this issue:
```
import asyncio
import time

from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.openai import OpenAIChat
from agno.utils.log import logger


async def atask1(delay: int):
    """Simulate a task that takes a random amount of time to complete
    Args:
        delay (int): The amount of time to delay the task
    """
    logger.info("Task 1 has started")
    for _ in range(delay):
        await asyncio.sleep(1)
        logger.info("Task 1 has slept for 1s")
    logger.info("Task 1 has completed")
    return f"Task 1 completed in {delay:.2f}s"


async def atask2(delay: int):
    """Simulate a task that takes a random amount of time to complete
    Args:
        delay (int): The amount of time to delay the task
    """
    logger.info("Task 2 has started")
    for _ in range(delay):
        await asyncio.sleep(1)
        logger.info("Task 2 has slept for 1s")
    logger.info("Task 2 has completed")
    return f"Task 2 completed in {delay:.2f}s"


async def atask3(delay: int):
    """Simulate a task that takes a random amount of time to complete
    Args:
        delay (int): The amount of time to delay the task
    """
    logger.info("Task 3 has started")
    for _ in range(delay):
        await asyncio.sleep(1)
        logger.info("Task 3 has slept for 1s")
    logger.info("Task 3 has completed")
    return f"Task 3 completed in {delay:.2f}s"


async_agent = Agent(
    model=OpenAIChat(id="gpt-4o-mini"),
    tools=[atask2, atask1, atask3],
    show_tool_calls=True,
    markdown=True,
)

asyncio.run(
    async_agent.aprint_response("Please run all tasks with a delay of 3s", stream=True)
)
```

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Mentioned in code.

## Expected Behavior
I expected all 3 tool calls to run normally in an async behavior.

## Actual Behavior
I got an error saying:
```

issues.title: [Bug] Async tools in team of agents not awaited properly, causing runtime errors
issues.body:
# Description
When using a team of agents with async tools, the tools are called synchronously, resulting in errors such as "coroutine was never awaited." This issue does not occur when the async tool is called directly from the main agent.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a team of agents.
2. Include an async tool in one of the agents.
3. Call the tool through the team setup.
4. Observe the error indicating that the coroutine was never awaited.

## Expected Behavior
The async tool should be awaited and executed correctly when called through a team of agents.

## Actual Behavior
The tool is called synchronously, resulting in a RuntimeWarning and a ValidationError indicating that the coroutine was never awaited.

## Screenshots or Logs 
```
  File "/app/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/pydantic/main.py", line 214, in __init__
    validated_self = self.__pydantic_validator__.validate_python(data, self_instance=self)
                     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
pydantic_core._pydantic_core.ValidationError: 2 validation errors for Message
content.list[any]
  Input should be a valid list [type=list_type, input_value=<coroutine object list_books at 0x7ffff627ca90>, input_type=coroutine]
    For further information visit https://errors.pydantic.dev/2.10/v/list_type
content.str
  Input should be a valid string [type=string_type, input_value=<coroutine object list_books at 0x7ffff627ca90>, input_type=coroutine]
    For further information visit https://errors.pydantic.dev/2.10/v/string_type
sys:1: RuntimeWarning: coroutine 'list_books' was never awaited
```

## Environment
OS: Ubuntu
Agno Version: v1.1.8
Additional Environment Details: Python 3.11.11

## Additional Context
The issue seems to be specific to the use of async tools within a team of agents. When the same tool is called directly from the main agent, it works as expected.

issues.body:
# Description
After adding a tool to an Agent, and calling to .arun method, I'm having this error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/dani/Developer/Happyforce/happyforce-ai/happyforce_hero/app/services/chat_service.py", line 255, in handle_chat_command
    async for response in agent.execute_command(
    ...<6 lines>...
        yield f"data: {json.dumps({'content': response.content})}\n\n"
  File "/Users/dani/Developer/Happyforce/happyforce-ai/happyforce_hero/app/agents/who_is_hero_agent.py", line 109, in execute_command
    async for response in run_response:
        yield response
  File "/Users/dani/Developer/Happyforce/happyforce-ai/.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/agno/agent/agent.py", line 1218, in _arun
    model_response.content = (model_response.content or "") + model_response_chunk.content
                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
**TypeError: can only concatenate str (not "bool") to str**

The tool is this:

` @tool(
            show_result=True,                               # Show result after function call
            stop_after_tool_call=True,                      # Return the result immediately after the tool call and stop the agent
            cache_results=False,                            # Enable caching of results
        )
        def verify_new_user(agent: Agent, user_id: str, session_id: str) -> bool:
            """
            A tool to verify if it is the first time you see a user.
            
            Args:
                agent: The agent making the verification
                user_id: The user ID to verify
                session_id: The current session ID
                
            Returns:
                bool: True if the user is new, False otherwise
            """
            return True
        
        return verify_new_user `

If I modify the tool to return a String, or I set **show_result** to False, it works.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Define an agent, with a tool.
2. Make the tool to return something different than a String, like a bool.
3. Call to the agent via arun (I've not tested with other functions), with Stream=True.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)

Nothing relevant

## Expected Behavior

No error or exception

## Actual Behavior

The agent should work.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)

Find attached above.

## Environment
- OS: macOS 15.3.1 
- Agno Version: 1.3.1

- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.13

## Possible Solutions (optional)
Suggest any ideas you might have to fix or address the issue.

## Additional Context
Add any other context or details about the problem here.
issues.author: DDani

comments.author: ysolanky
comments.body:
Hello @DDani ! The default behaviour of any tool is to result a string. So, when a tool returns a bool value instead, it is expected for an error to be thrown.

This happens because model APIs expect the result of a tool call to be a string in the response message. Please let us know if you have any

comments.body:

stop_after_tool_call=True # Return the result immediately after the tool call and stop the agent,

Also applies?

issues.title: [Bug]Session Memory getting duplicated even with different session ids
issues.body:
# Description
Even with new session ids, old memory is getting added to new ones.

## Steps to Reproduce
Cleared DB,
Logged into my web application, initiated a chat. Session id was null. I said hi, it responded hello. I asked what things u know about me. It said it my name, email etc details it knows.

Now there is one entry in session table.

Refreshed browser.

Send hi again with null session id. It responded hello.

Now there are 2 entries in session table. When i inspected memory column for the second session id, it was big and had memories from 1st session 

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
team = Team(
        name="xxxxx",
        model=azure_model,
        mode="route",
        members=[agent1,agnet2,agnent3],
        show_members_responses=True,
        enable_agentic_context=True,
        share_member_interactions=True,
        session_id= session_id,
        show_tool_calls=show_tool_calls,
        markdown=True,
        enable_team_history=True,
        debug_mode=agent_debug_mode,
        storage=storage,
        memory=memory,
        instructions = dedent("""\
            - xxxxxxxxxxxxx
        """),
        description="""xxxxxxxx """,
        #read_team_history = True,
        user_id = user_id
    )

## Expected Behavior
it should start from fresh since its new session id

## Actual Behavior
it acts like im continuning with the old session id

issues.title: [Bug] Gemini Embedded Rate Limits
issues.body:
# Description
Briefly describe the issue you‚Äôre experiencing or the bug you‚Äôve found.

The Gemini Embeddings API rate limit is being exceeded when loading data into the vector database .

## Agent Configuration
Provide relevant agent configuration.
```python
# --- Configuration ---
load_dotenv()

GEMINI_API_KEY = os.environ["GEMINI_API_KEY"]
DB_URL = os.environ["DB_URL"]
TABLE_NAME = os.environ["TABLE_NAME"]
CSV_FILE_PATH = os.environ["CSV_FILE_PATH"]

# --- Initialize Components ---
embedder = GeminiEmbedder(task_type="CLUSTERING" , api_key=GEMINI_API_KEY)
vector_db = PgVector(table_name=TABLE_NAME, db_url=DB_URL, embedder=embedder )
knowledge_base = CSVKnowledgeBase(path=CSV_FILE_PATH, vector_db=vector_db)
agent = Agent(knowledge=knowledge_base, search_knowledge=True)

# --- Load Data and Generate Embeddings ---
knowledge_base.load(recreate=False) # Set recreate=False after the first run

```
## Expected Behavior
What did you expect to happen?

The knowledge_base.load() function should successfully process the CSV file, generate embeddings for the content using the Gemini Embeddings API, and store these embeddings in the PostgreSQL database via PgVector, without exceeding the API's rate limits.

## Actual Behavior
What actually happened instead?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a9bb4b0c-201e-459b-9a5f-6f0e48a9600f)


## Possible Solutions
Suggest any ideas you might have to fix or address the issue.

Introduce a parameter within the PgVector.insert method (and potentially exposed through CSVKnowledgeBase.load) to control the rate of embedding calls. This could involve adding a delay_seconds parameter that introduces a pause between processing batches or even between individual document embeddings. This would allow users to configure the embedding process to respect the Gemini API rate limits.

issues.title: [Bug]Installation error
issues.body:
# Description

issues.title: [Bug] LiteLLM model can't properly handle the tool-calling when streaming
issues.body:
# Description
When using stream mode with sync & async mode in LiteLLM model, the tool calling is not properly handled streamed tool calling, caused crash.

## Steps to Reproduce
Example code

```python
import os
from textwrap import dedent
import time

from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.litellm import LiteLLM

# Define a tool that increments our counter and returns the new value
def increment_counter(agent: Agent, step: int, fast_mode: bool = False) -> str:
    """Increment the session counter and return the new value."""
    if not fast_mode:
        time.sleep(1)
    agent.session_state["count"] += step
    return f"The count is now {agent.session_state['count']}, step {step}, fast_mode {fast_mode}"

model = LiteLLM(
    id="openrouter/anthropic/claude-3.7-sonnet",
    api_key=os.environ.get("OPENROUTER_API_KEY"),
)

# Create a State Manager Agent that maintains state
agent = Agent(
    model=model,
    # Initialize the session state with a counter starting at 0
    session_state={"count": 0},
    tools=[increment_counter],
    # You can use variables from the session state in the instructions
    instructions=dedent("""\
        You are the State Manager, an enthusiastic guide to state management! üîÑ
        Your job is to help users understand state management through a simple counter example.

        Follow these guidelines for every interaction:
        1. Always acknowledge the current state (count) when relevant
        2. Use the increment_counter tool to modify the state
        3. Explain state changes in a clear and engaging way

        Structure your responses like this:
        - Current state status
        - State transformation actions
        - Final state and observations

        Starting state (count) is: {count}\
    """),
    show_tool_calls=True,
    markdown=True,
    debug_mode=True,
)

agent.print_response(
    "Increase the state by 3, using fast_mode=True",
    stream=True,
)

print(f"Final session state: {agent.session_state}")

```

issues.title: [Feature Request] Firecrawl search tool
issues.body:
## Problem Description
From my experience, [Firecrawl](https://www.firecrawl.dev/extract) provides the best service for extracting data from websites for LLM consumption (specifically with their "extract" service)

## Proposed Solution
Similar to some of the other search tools, but with the underlying provider being Firecrawl/ Firecrawl Extract. They already provide integrations with other frameworks, so it is possible reaching out to them would be another approach here (https://docs.firecrawl.dev/integrations)

## Alternatives Considered
There exist multiple alternatives within the official Agno toolset, but I have had better eval input with the information able to be extracted with Firecrawl

## Would you like to work on this?

Mainly sharing the idea, but not adverse to implementing it myself. If there is additional buy-in/interest I would place this higher on my list of priorities.

issues.title: [Bug] Inconsistent AgenticChunking results
issues.body:
# Description
This is not a bug explicitly but more of an improvement tbh. The current implementation of the agent-based chunking logic relies solely on an LLM to determine a numeric breakpoint at the character level within the first max_chunk_size characters. This approach is not robust, I feel, or unreliable in production use cases because LLMs are inherently stochastic and not ideal for this granular/precise counting task/ numerical arithmetic task, although this being said with more powerful models the scope of error or inconsistency in counting reduces.. Due to this implementation, the chunk boundaries may fall in the middle of words, sentences, or paragraphs, leading to a loss of semantic integrity or completeness of the chunk.


## Steps to Reproduce
https://colab.research.google.com/drive/14UcHZqsfm6LkDvYfhbkc6yITgUoWs4Vu?usp=sharing

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Provide relevant agent configuration.

## Expected Behavior
- sentence-level chunking with each chunk being independently coherent and complete

## Actual Behavior
- character level chunking with breakpoints encountered in between sentences/words leading to a loss in semantic coherence and completeness of the chunk.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/09c46829-34b5-4a7b-bc65-995efa643958)

## Environment
- OS: (e.g. macOS)
- Agno Version: (1.1.14)

## Possible Solutions (optional)
I gave a thought on how the logic can be improved, sharing them here:
- First is to replace character level break points with sentence level breakpoints ( this will require some tuning in the prompt and string slicing logic IMO)
- Second is rather than asking the LLM to return breakpoints, we can leverage structured outputs to return a list of coherent chunks in the llm output, however with this approach I see some tradeoffs w.r.t llm inference cost.
- Third is using something called Propositional chunking ( inspired from [this paper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2312.06648) ) or can refer to [this](https://github.com/FullStackRetrieval-com/RetrievalTutorials/blob/main/tutorials/LevelsOfTextSplitting/5_Levels_Of_Text_Splitting.ipynb)

## Additional Context
Please lemme know your thoughts on this or if I did anything wrong or if there are some gaps in my understanding, would really be grateful!

issues.title: [Bug] Gemini unable to delegate tasks to team members
issues.body:
# Description
Using a Team with gemini doesn't work.

## Steps to Reproduce
Create a new project and run this code

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```python
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.google import Gemini
from agno.team.team import Team
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from typing import List
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

load_dotenv()
class MovieScript(BaseModel):
    setting: str = Field(..., description="Provide a nice setting for a blockbuster movie.")
    ending: str = Field(..., description="Ending of the movie. If not available, provide a happy ending.")
    genre: str = Field(
        ..., description="Genre of the movie. If not available, select action, thriller or romantic comedy."
    )
    name: str = Field(..., description="Give a name to this movie")
    characters: List[str] = Field(..., description="Name of characters for this movie.")
    storyline: str = Field(..., description="3 sentence storyline for the movie. Make it exciting!")

# Agent that uses JSON mode
json_mode_agent = Agent(
    model=Gemini(id="gemini-2.0-flash"),
    role="You write movie scripts.",
    response_model=MovieScript,
    use_json_mode=True,
)
agent = Team(
    name="Agent",
    mode="route",
    model=Gemini(id="gemini-2.5-pro-exp-03-25"),
    members=[json_mode_agent],
    description="Given a topic, ask the json_mode_agent to return a structured movie script",
    add_datetime_to_instructions=True,
    enable_agentic_context=True,  # Allow the agent to maintain a shared context and send that to members.
    share_member_interactions=True,  # Share all member responses with subsequent member requests.
    show_members_responses=True,
    markdown=True,
    debug_mode=True,
)

agent.print_response("New York")
```

## Expected Behavior
Response with script in structured format

## Actual Behavior
Team attempts to call json_mode_agent but can't.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/90bd1a2c-f0b0-468b-8bc1-cdf354f76504)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6db14886-8f00-4de4-bde7-903b3fb83401)

## Environment
- OS: Windows 11
- Agno Version: 1.2.16
- Additional Environment Details: 3.11

Hi @thismart595 
You have to give your agent a name for the delegation to work, because the agent ID is derived from the name. I will make a change to make this easier.

issues.title: No thinking output with deepseek!
issues.body:
No thinking output with deepseek!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e6e5d4e8-bfc1-4a08-ba09-a7603d1f8b47)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a841fd9f-8e9d-4a2c-bfc6-ca280dc56eda)
issues.author: shenshouer

comments.author: dirkbrnd
comments.body:
Hi @shenshouer 
I don't think the default deepseek model (i.e. `deepseek-chat`) does reasoning by default. I believe you need to set `DeepSeek(id="deepseek-reasoner")`

comments.author: shenshouer
comments.body:
@dirkbrnd Thank you very much for your point out, I indeed forgot to specify the specific model ID. But I set the model ID to `deepseek-reasoner` according to your hint, and there is still no content output of thinking process in the console.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c20

comments.author: IATkachenko
comments.body:
@dirkbrnd, hello!

Have same issue with `deepseek-r1-distill-qwen-14b`: model (via `LMStudio`, that goes from `OpenAILike`, same as `DeepSeek`) is sending `reasoning_content` in `delta` part of response (just checked with wireshark/tcpdump), but it does not shown in console.

My configuration is
```

issues.title: [Bug] Agent Teams - Orchestration Issue
issues.body:
# Description
Using content cookbook with different models:
Here is the agent script:
```
import dotenv
from openai import OpenAI
dotenv.load_dotenv()

from agno.agent.agent import Agent
from agno.models.openai.chat import OpenAIChat
from agno.models.google.gemini import Gemini
from agno.models.openrouter.openrouter import OpenRouter
from agno.team.team import Team
from agno.tools.duckduckgo import DuckDuckGoTools

# Create individual specialized agents
researcher = Agent(
    name="Researcher",
    role="Expert at finding information",
    tools=[DuckDuckGoTools()],
    model=OpenRouter(id="mistralai/mistral-small-3.1-24b-instruct:free"),
    show_tool_calls=True
)

writer = Agent(
    name="Writer",
    role="Expert at writing clear, engaging content",
    model=OpenRouter(id="mistralai/mistral-small-3.1-24b-instruct:free"),
)

# Create a team with these agents
content_team = Team(
    name="Content Team",
    mode="coordinate",
    members=[researcher, writer],
    instructions="You are a team of researchers and writers that work together to create high-quality content.",
    model=OpenRouter(id="google/gemini-2.5-pro-exp-03-25:free"),
    debug_mode=True
)

# Run the team with a task
content_team.print_response("Create a short article about quantum computing")
```

## Steps to Reproduce
List the steps needed to encounter this bug or issue.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Provide relevant agent configuration.

## Expected Behavior
To have the script create the article.

## Actual Behavior
On running script it fails with weird behaviour, If you see below, the Researcher agent fails to make successful tool call, but it does not retry and the team agent simply says it has scheduled things and comes out of agent loop.

        Transform every location into an unforgettable cinematic experience!\
    """),
    response_model=MovieScript,
)

# Structured Output Agent

structured_output_agent = Agent(
    model=Groq(
        id='meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct',
    ),

    """),
    expected_output=MovieScript,

# json_mode_agent.print_response("Dubai 2050", stream=True)

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow/Agent `run_id` consistency
issues.body:
# Description

 `run_id`s aren't staying consistent between a workflow and it's agents. 

`Workflow._run()` updates `RunResponse` instances returned from agent runs with its own `run_id`, but at that point the agent has already written itself to storage. In memory things are synced but storage is not.  The agent will `read_from_storage` on its next run and in-memory state while be out of sync too.

## Steps to Reproduce

Execute more than one run in a workflow and note that:

- in memory, all `run_id`s bar the last are no longer consistent
- in storage, no `run_id`s are consistent

## Workaround 

Manually write each agent to storage after a run.

## Possible Solutions 

I won't have spent as much time thinking about these things as the authors but it seems like a design problem to me, and solutions will come from reconsidering or reworking either:

- the relationship between Workflow and Agent 
- or the approach to storage

Workflow seems to have a few areas where it improved in terms of being a collection of agents, like a better mechanism for aggregating `RunResponse`s from agents.

There are a lot of reads and writes to storage in Agno and there is a lot of redundant data stored, which I expect will both either have some motivation or be on a list of things to revisit.
issues.author: mediumchris

issues.title: Empty anthropic responses generated but these are invalid when sent back to the model
issues.body:
# Description
Anthropic model sometimes responds with empty assistant messages (empty content) with tool calls. However sending these back in results in an error.

ValueError: Bad response code, expected 200: {'status_code': 400, 'headers': {':exception-type': 'validationException', ':content-type': 'application/json', ':message-type': 'exception'}, 'body': b'{"message":"messages: text content blocks must contain non-whitespace text"}'}

## Steps to Reproduce
Should be reproducible on any anthropic model. 

## Expected Behavior
I guess we need to find the right way to handle empty whitespace or newline messages from the model. Maybe we should replace the empty message with a dot? 

## Actual Behavior
This crashes the agent because empty content messages are invalid with anthropic.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7ce0fb62-f18c-497c-8cba-bdcb975513b6)

## Environment
- Anthropic Claude 3.7 on bedrock.
issues.author: mkschreder

comments.author: ysolanky
comments.body: Hello @mkschreder ! This has been fixed and will be a part of the next release. Thank you!

issues.title: [Bug]  Issue Connecting Workflow to Playground ‚Äì Errors Fetching Workflow Input Fields & Sessions
issues.body:
# Description
I am encountering difficulties when trying to connect my workflow to the Agno Playground. The workflow appears in the UI, but when I click on it, I receive errors such as:

"Failed to fetch workflow input fields."
"Failed to fetch the session."

I am unsure where to look to resolve this issue.

Logs from the api
```
INFO:     127.0.0.1:56782 - "GET /v1/playground/workflows/None HTTP/1.1" 404 Not Found
INFO:     127.0.0.1:56782 - "GET /v1/playground/workflows/None/sessions?user_id=c271759c-d52a-4bce-badd-eb95235bee33 HTTP/1.1" 404 Not Found
INFO:     127.0.0.1:56782 - "GET /v1/playground/workflows/None HTTP/1.1" 404 Not Found
```

## Steps to Reproduce
Below is the relevant portion of my code configuring the Playground:

```
# Access the underlying agent objects
agent_analyzer: Agent = transaction_agent.agent # get the Agno source Agent
agent_check: Agent = enrichment_check.agent # get the Agno source Agent

# Create workflow
workflow = TransactionWorkflow(
    transaction_agent=transaction_agent, #wrapper 
    check_agent=check_agent, # wrapper
    debug=False
)

# Set up playground
settings = PlaygroundSettings(env="dev")
app = Playground(
    agents=[agent_analyzer, agent_check],
    workflows=[workflow],
    settings=settings
).get_app(use_async=False)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    serve_playground_app("src.playground_agents:app", reload=True)
```

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Provide relevant agent configuration.

## Expected Behavior
What did you expect to happen?



## Environment
- Python3.11 with latest Agno version (1.1.13)

Could you please provide guidance on how to resolve this issue? Let me know if you need additional information.
issues.author: lironesamoun

comments.author: manthanguptaa
comments.body: Hey @lironesamoun! Is it possible to share the code for `TransactionWorkflow`? Here is a doc by the way to help you write your workflow, which might help you debug as well. Right now I am not sure how you are defining TransactionWorkflow which might be the problem in this case

comments.author: lironesamoun
comments.body:
Yes, this is part of the code with name variable modification


```
class TransactionWorkflow(Workflow):
    """
    Workflow
    """

    def __init__(self, agent_analyzer, agent_check, debug: bool = False, **kwargs):

        super().__init__(**kwargs)
        self.agent_analyzer = agent_analyzer

issues.title: [Bug] Gemini API Error: Invalid Type in Function Declarations with Multiple Tools (Vertex AI)
issues.body:
# Description
I'm encountering an error when trying to use Gemini with multiple tools in Agno using the Vertex AI API. The error occurs specifically with function declarations and parameter types in the Gemini API.


## Steps to Reproduce
Create a new Python file with the following imports:
```
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.google import Gemini
from agno.tools.duckduckgo import DuckDuckGoTools
from agno.tools.exa import ExaTools
```

Create an agent with multiple tools using Vertex AI:
```
agent = Agent(
    name="Test Agent",
    model=Gemini(
        id="gemini-2.0-flash-exp",
        vertexai=True,  # Using Vertex AI API
        project_id="your-project-id",
        location="us-central1"
    ),
    tools=[DuckDuckGoTools(), ExaTools()]
)
```


Try to use the agent with a simple query:
`await agent.aprint_response("What is the best way to learn to ride a boat?")`

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```
agent = Agent(
    name="Test Agent",
    model=Gemini(
        id="gemini-2.0-flash-exp",
        vertexai=True,  # Using Vertex AI API
        project_id="your-project-id",
        location="us-central1"
    ),
    tools=[DuckDuckGoTools(), ExaTools()]
)
```

## Expected Behavior
The agent should successfully use the provided tools to search and return results using Gemini's function calling API through Vertex AI.

## Actual Behavior
The Vertex AI API returns a 400 INVALID_ARGUMENT error:
`Invalid value at 'tools[0].function_declarations[1].parameters.properties[0].value.type' (type.googleapis.com/google.cloud.aiplatform.v1beta1.Type), ""`

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
```
Error: 400 INVALID_ARGUMENT
Details: Invalid value at 'tools[0].function_declarations[1].parameters.properties[0].value.type' (type.googleapis.com/google.cloud.aiplatform.v1beta1.Type), ""
```

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/91b50a4d-1b81-4654-961d-beb1d6281388)

## Environment
- OS: macOS Sequoia Version 15.3.2
- Agno Version: 1.2.6
- Google Cloud:
- [ ] Project configured
- [ ] Vertex AI API enabled
- [ ] Using Vertex AI's Gemini model (not the Google AI studio Gemini API)

## Dependencies:
-     google-genai: 1.8.0
-     duckduckgo-search: 7.5.5
-     googlesearch-python: 1.3.0
-     pycountry: 24.6.1
-     pypdf: 5.4.0
-     arxiv: 2.1.3
-     Python: 3.13.0

## Possible Solutions (optional)

1. Update the tool declarations to use proper Vertex AI types
2. Modify the Gemini model implementation to handle tool declarations internally
3. Add explicit type conversion in the tool classes
4. Consider using a different model version that better handles function calling
5. Consider switching to direct Gemini API instead of Vertex AI if the issue persists

## Additional Context
- The error occurs specifically with multiple tools
- Single tool usage works fine
- The error suggests an issue with parameter type definitions in the function declarations
I've tried various approaches including:
- Adding explicit type hints
- Creating tool schemas
- Using different model versions
- Removing optional parameters
The error is specific to Vertex AI's implementation of Gemini's function calling API

Hello,
I am running into the same problem using the team agent and figured out the conversion of the tool schema is failing with certain types.

The _convert_schema() from agno.models.google.gemini doesn't support multiple types of input for one argument of a function.
Here is an example of  two too

comments.author: MischaPanch
comments.body: Yes, there are multiple problems in that schema. Also the required field is not set correctly for args with defaults. Google's schema also does not have a null type, so optional types need special treatment. We (@opcode81) patched the conversion function in our code to deal with the absence of null

issues.title: [Bug] MongoDB index creation always uses default embedding dim
issues.body:
The MongoDB index creation takes the embedding dimension from the embedder as
```py
embedding_dim = getattr(self.embedder, "embedding_dim", 1536)
```

But the dimension attribute in the `Embedder` class is named `dimensions` and so it always goes to the default value.

I tried changing the embed dimension just on a whim and it started giving errors saying the index dim and the query dim don't match. I spent way too long in the night trying to debug this. But seems this was the problem. 
Or rather I hope this was the problem. I think?

issues.title: [Bug] AttributeError in Team Agent Memory when retrieving previous messages from database
issues.body:
# Description
A `TeamMemory` bug in the Agno library causing an `AttributeError` when trying to access `run.response.messages` because `run.response` is a dictionary, not an object with attributes.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a `Team` with `TeamMemory` using a database backend
2. Perform a run with the team using `arun()`
3. Perform another run, which triggers loading historical messages
4. Error occurs in `get_messages_from_last_n_runs` when trying to access messages from previous runs

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```python
team = Team(
    name=self.team_name,
    team_id=self.team_id,
    user_id=self.user_id,
    mode="route",
    model=OpenAIChat(
        id="gpt-4o",
        max_tokens=4096,
        temperature=0,
        seed=42,
    ),
    members=[agent1, agent2],
    storage=PostgresAgentStorage(
        table_name="agent_team_sessions",
        db_engine=engine,
        schema="public",
    ),
    memory=TeamMemory(
        db=PgMemoryDb(
            table_name="agent_team_memory",
            db_engine=engine,
            schema="public",
        ),
        user_id=user_id,
        create_user_memories=True,
        update_user_memories_after_run=True,
    ),
    enable_team_history=True,
)
```

## Expected Behavior
The `get_messages_from_last_n_runs` method should properly handle serialized `run.response` objects. When a response is retrieved from storage, it's returned as a dictionary, so the code should either:

1. Access the messages using dictionary syntax (`run.response["messages"]`) instead of attribute syntax (`run.response.messages`), or
2. Properly reconstruct the `TeamRunResponse` object from the dictionary before accessing its attributes

The bug is caused by a mismatch between how data is serialized for storage (converted to dictionary) and how it's accessed after retrieval (treated as if it were still an object).

## Actual Behavior
The method fails with `AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'messages'` because it tries to access `run.response.messages` when `run.response` is a dictionary stored in the database.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/workspace/src/services/ai/agents/team_agent.py", line 314, in generate_response
    response = await self.team.arun(
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/agno/team/team.py", line 1101, in arun
    run_messages: RunMessages = self.get_run_messages(
                                ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/agno/team/team.py", line 3373, in get_run_messages
    history: List[Message] = self.memory.get_messages_from_last_n_runs(
                             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/agno/memory/team.py", line 220, in get_messages_from_last_n_runs
    if not (run.response and run.response.messages):
                             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'messages'
```

Response dictionary structure in memory:
```json
{
  "response": {
    "event": "RunResponse",
    "model": "gpt-4o",
    "messages": [
      {
        "role": "system",
        "content": "...",
        "created_at": 1742784102,
        "from_history": false,
        "stop_after_tool_call": false
      }
    ],
    "created_at": 1742783994,
    "session_id": "1742784094.196249",
    "content_type": "str"
  }
}
```

## Environment
- OS: Linux (Ubuntu)
- Agno Version: 1.1.15
- External Dependency Versions: SQLAlchemy 2.0.36
- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.11

## Possible Solutions (optional)
When loading TeamRun from storage, convert dictionary responses back to TeamRunResponse objects:

```
# In TeamRun deserialization logic
if isinstance(response_dict, dict):
    return TeamRunResponse(**response_dict)
```

## Additional Context
This issue occurs because of a serialization/deserialization mismatch. When `TeamRunResponse` objects are stored in the database, they're serialized to dictionaries. When retrieved, they remain as dictionaries but the code tries to access them as if they were objects with attributes.

issues.title: [bug]How can I structured output in a specified response_model after calling the search tool
issues.body:
## Problem Description
How can I make the Agent generate structured output in a specified response_model after calling the search tool?

I have implemented a response_model class as follows:
```
    class SearcherOutput(BaseModel):

        results: str = Field(..., title="Â≠óÁ¨¶‰∏≤Ë°®Á§∫ÁöÑÊü•ËØ¢ÁªìÊûúÔºàjsonÊ†ºÂºèÔºâ")
```
And I have written a toolkits named 'KnowledgeSearchTools' that contains various search functions, each of which returns the search result as a string in JSON format.

Then I created an agent as follows:
```
    searcher: Agent = Agent(
        model = Ollama(
            id=config['Ollama']['llm_model'],
            host=config['Ollama']['generate_url'],
        ),
        description="Search information such as XXX using the tool and organize the results into a JSON format for the response.",
        tools=[KnowledgeSearchTools(
            vector_db=Clickhouse(
                table_name="recipe_documents",
                host=config['Clickhouse']['host'],
                port=config['Clickhouse']['port'],
                username=config['Clickhouse']['username'],
                password=config['Clickhouse']['password'],
                embedder=OllamaEmbedder(
                    id=config['Ollama']['embed_model'],
                    host=config['Ollama']['embed_url'],
                )
            )
        )],
        response_model=SearcherOutput,
        show_tool_calls=True,
        instructions=dedent("""\
           You can use the KnowledgeSearchTools to query the following information:
            1.XXX information
            2.XXX information
            3.XXX information
            4.XXX information
            5.XXX information
            6.XXX information
            Select one or more search tools based on the content you want to search, and directly convert the search 
 results into JSON for the response. Do not provide any summaries, analyses, or other additional content.\
        """),
        read_chat_history = True,
        debug_mode=True
    )
```
In the code above, XXX represents a certain type of knowledge data.

I have already specified the `response_model`, and I have also required the agent in the prompt to return in JSON format. The debugging information for the prompt given to the searcher is as follows:

```
DEBUG    Search information such as XXX using the tool and organize the results into a JSON format for the response.                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                                           
         <instructions>                                                                                                                                                                    
         You can use the KnowledgeSearchTools to query the following information:
            XXX information
            XXX information
            XXX information
            XXX information
            XXX information
            XXX information
            Select one or more search tools based on the content you want to search, and directly convert the search 
 results into JSON for the response. Do not provide any summaries, analyses, or other additional content.„ÄÇ                                                       
         </instructions>                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                           
         Provide your output as a JSON containing the following fields:                                                                                                                    
         <json_fields>                                                                                                                                                                     
         ["results"]                                                                                                                                                                       
         </json_fields>                                                                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                                                                           
         Here are the properties for each field:                                                                                                                                           
         <json_field_properties>                                                                                                                                                           
         {                                                                                                                                                                                 
           "results": {                                                                                                                                                                    
             "type": "string"                                                                                                                                                              
           }                                                                                                                                                                               
         }                                                                                                                                                                                 
         </json_field_properties>                                                                                                                                                          
         Start your response with `{` and end it with `}`.                                                                                                                                 
         Your output will be passed to json.loads() to convert it to a Python object.                                                                                                      
         Make sure it only contains valid JSON.               
```
This agent correctly invoked the tools, and these tools returned correct query results as follows:
```
DEBUG    ============== tool ==============                                                                                                                                                
DEBUG    {"ÊºèÊ¥û‰ø°ÊÅØÔºö": ["{\"cnnvd_number\": \"CNNVD-199703-008\", \"content_column_name\": \"content\", \"create_time\": \"2024-07-10 10:15:03\", \"created\": \"2023/11/28 19:15\",      
         \"cve_number\": \"CVE-1999-0299\", \"file_name\": \"vulnerability.jsonl\", \"id\": \"03f2f3e3-d0cf-4967-bcca-6c78aa2805b8\", \"manufacturer\": \"freebsd\", \"name\": \"FreeBSD   
         lpdÁºìÂÜ≤Âå∫ÈîôËØØÊºèÊ¥û\", \"note\": \"\", \"patch_file\": \"\", \"release_date\": \"2007/7/13 0:00\", \"source\": \"cnnvd\", \"table_id\": 3287, \"update_date\": \"2007/7/13 0:00\",  
         \"introduction\": \"FreeBSD lpdÂ≠òÂú®Ë∂ÖÈïøDNS‰∏ªÊú∫ÂêçÁºìÂÜ≤Âå∫Ê∫¢Âá∫ÊºèÊ¥û„ÄÇ\"}", "{\"cnnvd_number\": \"CNNVD-200912-140\", \"content_column_name\": \"content\", \"create_time\":            
         \"2024-07-10 10:15:03\", \"created\": \"2023/11/28 19:15\", \"cve_number\": \"CVE-2009-4265\", \"file_name\": \"vulnerability.jsonl\", ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶]}
```

However, after obtaining the query results from the tools, the agent analyzed and organized the information, ignoring my prompt requirements, including returning in JSON format and not adding any analytical or summarizing content. The result is as follows:
```
‚†¶ Working...DEBUG    ============== assistant ==============                                                                                                                                           
DEBUG    Based on the queried information, here is a list of several representative CVEs and their brief introductionsÔºö                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                           
         1. **CVE-2001-1093**                                                                                                                                                              
            - Related softwareÔºöDigital Unix MSGCHK                                                                                                                                                
            - VendorÔºöCompaq                                                                                                                                                               
            - descriptionÔºöThe vulnerability exists in msgchk of Digital UNIX 4.0G and earlier versions, where there is a buffer overflow issue. Local users can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code.„ÄÇ                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                           
         2. **CVE-2009-2460**                                                                                                                                                              
            - XXX                                                                                                                                       
            - XXX                                                                                                                                                              
            - XXX„ÄÇ                                                                              
                                                                                                                                                                                           
         3.XXX                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                       
         The above examples demonstrate various security issues and their impacts in different software. This information can help identify potential threats in systems and take appropriate measures to mitigate or fix these issues. It is recommended to regularly update applications and patches to ensure system security.
```

This ultimately leads to the following error when I process the agent's result.
```
WARNING  Failed to parse cleaned JSON: 1 validation error for SearcherOutput                                                                                                               
           Invalid JSON: expected value at line 1 column 1 [type=json_invalid, input_value='Based on the queried information, ...applications and patches to ensure system security.', input_type=str]                                            
             For further information visit https://errors.pydantic.dev/2.10/v/json_invalid      
```

However, when I input the prompt directly into the large model (qwen2.5:14b from ollama) used by the agent, combining the above prompt, tool query results, and user input, I get a result in JSON format as expected.

So, how should I set it up to make the `searcher` agent generate structured JSON output as I require?

Note: The code itself outputs in Chinese. For convenience, I translated the results into English and included them in this issue. The large model used is Qwen 2.5:14b. The agno version is 1.1.10
issues.author: DimRgs

        descrip

issues.title: [Bug] Tool calls not returning values depending on output string
issues.body: # Description I am experiencing a really erratic, but reproducible behavior regarding tool calls with some of the models (confirmed with Gemini and Amazon Nova). I have simple tools without parameters just returning some text. Depending on some slight variation of the text, the output is either registered correctly or registered as empty by the model. ## Steps to Reproduce I have a minimal reproducible example. The text is in german, but it captures the behavior. Both tools return an almost similar text, the second one just omitting the second paragraph. Now running those tools with GPT-4o works fine. With Gemini or Nova, the second tool just has an empty response {}. Funnily, if you remove the first paragraph instead, it also yields a proper response, so it cannot be a problem with a weird token or such. Just the combination of both paragraphs fail. ```python from agno.models.openrouter.openrouter import OpenRouter from agno.agent.agent import Agent from textwrap import dedent from dotenv import load_dotenv load_dotenv(".env") def tool1() -> str: """ Get some text. """ return dedent(""" ‚Äû(1) Ein Zentralverwahrer ermittelt Quellen des internen und externen operationellen Risikos und h√§lt deren Auswirkungen durch den Einsatz angemessener IKT-Tools, Verfahren und Strategien, die gem√§√ü der Verordnung (EU) 2022/2554 des Europ√§ischen Parlaments und des Rates (*3) eingerichtet und verwaltet werden, sowie durch alle anderen relevanten angemessenen Instrumente, Kontrollen und Verfahren f√ºr andere Arten operationeller Risiken, auch f√ºr alle von ihm betriebenen Wertpapierliefer- und -abrechnungssysteme, so gering wie m√∂glich. (*3) Verordnung (EU) 2022/2554 des Europ√§ischen Parlaments und des Rates vom 14. Dezember 2022 √ºber die digitale operationale Resilienz im Finanzsektor und zur √Ñnderung der Verordnungen (EG) Nr. 1060/2009, (EU) Nr. 648/2012, (EU) Nr. 600/2014, (EU) Nr. 909/2014 und (EU) 2016/1011 (ABl. L 333 vom 27.12.2022, S. 1).‚Äú" 2. Absatz 2 wird gestrichen """) def tool2() -> str: """ Get some text. """ return dedent("""" ‚Äû(1) Ein Zentralverwahrer ermittelt Quellen des internen und externen operationellen Risikos und h√§lt deren Auswirkungen durch den Einsatz angemessener IKT-Tools, Verfahren und Strategien, die gem√§√ü der Verordnung (EU) 2022/2554 des Europ√§ischen Parlaments und des Rates (*3) eingerichtet und verwaltet werden, sowie durch alle anderen relevanten angemessenen Instrumente, Kontrollen und Verfahren f√ºr andere Arten operationeller Risiken, auch f√ºr alle von ihm betriebenen Wertpapierliefer- und -abrechnungssysteme, so gering wie m√∂glich. (*3) Verordnung (EU) 2022/2554 des Europ√§ischen Parlaments und des Rates vom 14. Dezember 2022 √ºber die digitale operationale Resilienz im Finanzsektor und zur √Ñnderung der Verordnungen (EG) Nr. 1060/2009, (EU) Nr. 648/2012, (EU) Nr. 600/2014, (EU) Nr. 909/2014 und (EU) 2016/1011 (ABl. L 333 vom 27.12.2022, S. 1).‚Äú" """) # OpenAI can handle both tools agent = Agent( debug_mode=False, name="ToolAgent", description="You are an agent and can call tools.", model=OpenRouter(id="gpt-4o", temperature=1), markdown=True, tools=[ tool1, tool2 ], show_tool_calls=True ) agent.print_response("Run two tools and return their values", stream=True) # This one works with Gemini agent = Agent( debug_mode=False, name="ToolAgent", description="You are an agent and can call tools.", model=OpenRouter(id="google/gemini-2.0-flash-001", temperature=1), markdown=True, tools=[ tool2 # running tool2 only ], show_tool_calls=True ) agent.print_response("Run tool and return value", stream=True) # This one fails with Gemini (tool returns {}) agent = Agent( debug_mode=False, name="ToolAgent", description="You are an agent and can call tools.", model=OpenRouter(id="google/gemini-2.0-flash-001", temperature=1), markdown=True, tools=[ tool1 # running tool1 only ], show_tool_calls=True ) agent.print_response("Run tool and return value", stream=True) ``` ## Expected Behavior I expect both tool calls to properly return their values so the model can work with it. ## Actual Behavior Only tool2 returns a value. Tool1 returns {}. ## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable) ## Environment - OS: macOS - Agno Version: 1.1.13 - Additional Environment Details: Python 3.11.11
issues.author: MartinHanewald

```python
def tool1() -> dict:
    """
    Get some text.
    """
    return json.dumps({"result":dedent("""
‚Äû(1) Ein Zentralverwahrer ermittelt Quellen de

I was using Agent with team and it was working fine, I am migrating to the new Team (TeamAgent) pattern where I am getting unexpected behavior after few conversation. It response okay for few back and forth for the session but after few conversation (It is very random when it will happen) it throws error TeamMemory.__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'create_session_summary',

Use new Team to create Team Agent with SQLite Storage.

issues.title: [Bug] created_at field is NULL when creating workflow session
issues.body:
# Description  
When a workflow session is created and stored in the database, the `created_at` field is set to `NULL` and never updated. However, the `updated_at` field is correctly populated at the end of the workflow.

## Steps to Reproduce  
1. Run a workflow.  
2. After completion, check the database entry for the workflow session.  
3. Observe that the `created_at` value is `NULL`.

## Expected Behavior  
The `created_at` field should be populated with the correct timestamp when the workflow session is created.

## Actual Behavior  
The `created_at` field remains `NULL` after the workflow is completed.

## Environment  
- OS: macOS  
- Agno Version: 1.2.6  
- Python Version: 3.11.11
issues.author: NTTLuke

comments.author: mishramonalisha76
comments.body:
Hi @NTTLuke Thanks for sharing the issue . 
I was not able to replicate this issue on my end , I got the data for created_at for a workflow session . 
Can you please check with the latest version of the [sdk](https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/releases/tag/v1.2.7) ?

comments.author: NTTLuke
comments.body: Even when using version 1.2.7 I'm still experiencing the same issue. I'll investigate further and provide more information about this.

comments.author: NTTLuke
comments.body: Found the issue .. my mistake.

issues.title: When using groq in Team coordinate mode, groq.BadRequestError: Error code: 400 often occurs
issues.body:
# Description
When using groq in Team coordinate mode, groq.BadRequestError: Error code: 400 often occurs

## Steps to Reproduce
`task = "Tell me something about ThaiRecipes.pdf from knowledge base" 
agent_team.print_response(task , stream=False)
`

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
agno==1.2.6
model=Groq(id='qwen-qwq-32b',timeout=60)
task = "Tell me something about ThaiRecipes.pdf from knowledge base"

## Expected Behavior
No 400 errors occur at any time

## Actual Behavior
agno.exceptions.ModelProviderError: {"error":{"message":"Failed to call a function. Please adjust your prompt. See 'failed_generation' for more details.","type":"invalid_request_error","code":"tool_u
se_failed","failed_generation":"\u003ctool_call\u003e\n{\"name\": \"transfer_task_to_member\", \"arguments\": \"{\\\"agent_name\\\": \\\"Knowledge Agent\\\", \\\"task_description\\\": \\\"Retrieve information about ThaiRecipes.pdf from the knowledge base\\\", \\\"expected_output\\\": \\\"Content summary or key details contained in the ThaiRecipes.pdf document.\\\"}\"}\n\u003c/tool_call\u003e"}} 
## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
Include any relevant screenshots or error logs that demonstrate the issue.

## Environment
- OS: (e.g. macOS, Windows 11)
- Browser (if relevant): (e.g. Chrome 108, Firefox 107)
- Agno Version: 1.2.6
- Model provider: Groq
- Model:qwen-qwq-32b
- Python 3.13

## Possible Solutions (optional)

Prompt will induce the model to generate forged tools to call the structure into the content field,

## Additional Context
I hope this problem can be solved. Thanks for your contribution to the open source project.
issues.author: tangmingcheng

comments.author: willemcdejongh
comments.body:
Hi @tangmingcheng Thank you for using Agno!
Unfortunately this can happen with Groq. We can recommend to either use `exponential_backoff` on the agent to see if that mitigates the issue or trying another model that might be better at tool calling.

comments.author: tangmingcheng
comments.body: I switched to the GPT-4O model and the problem no longer exists

issues.title: [Bug]
issues.body:
# Description
When loading PDF documents containing mathematical formulas into the knowledge base, agno's PDF processing fails to handle Unicode surrogate characters, resulting in UnicodeEncodeError exceptions at multiple points in the processing pipeline.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a PDFKnowledgeBase with a PgVector
2. Add PDFs containing mathematical formulas or special symbols
3. Call the knowledge_base.load() method
4. Observe the encoding errors during document processing

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)

```
from agno.knowledge.pdf import PDFKnowledgeBase
from agno.vectordb.pgvector import PgVector
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.openai import OpenAIChat

dl_knowledge_base = PDFKnowledgeBase(
    path="data/pdf/deep_learning",
    vector_db=PgVector(
        table_name="pdf_documents",
        db_url=os.getenv("VECTOR_DB_URI"),
    ),
)

agent = Agent(
    name="My Agent",
    model=OpenAIChat("gpt-4o"),
    knowledge=dl_knowledge_base,
    search_knowledge=True,
)
agent.knowledge.load(recreate=False) 
```
## Expected Behavior
The PDFs containing mathematical symbols and formulas should be loaded into the knowledge base without encoding errors, properly handling any Unicode characters.

## Actual Behavior
Loading fails with multiple Unicode encoding errors:

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
```
INFO     Loading knowledge base                                                
INFO     Reading: Deep Learning from Scratch                                   
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\DELL\Desktop\work_projects\________\main.py", line 6, in <module>
    from router import prep_router,dashboard_router,chat_router
  File "C:\Users\DELL\Desktop\work_projects\________\router\__init__.py", line 3, in <module>
    from .chat import chat_router
  File "C:\Users\DELL\Desktop\work_projects\________\router\chat.py", line 3, in <module>
    from core.chat_core import chat_core
  File "C:\Users\DELL\Desktop\work_projects\________\core\chat_core.py", line 53, in <module>
    One_gate_agent.knowledge.load(recreate=False)
  File "C:\Users\DELL\Desktop\work_projects\________\venv\Lib\site-packages\agno\knowledge\agent.py", line 101, in load
    if doc.content not in seen_content and not self.vector_db.doc_exists(doc):
                                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\DELL\Desktop\work_projects\________\venv\Lib\site-packages\agno\vectordb\pgvector\pgvector.py", line 237, in doc_exists
    content_hash = md5(cleaned_content.encode()).hexdigest()
                       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
UnicodeEncodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't encode character '\ud835' in position 879: surrogates not allowed

```
## Environment

- OS: Windows
- Agno Version: 1.1.8
- External Dependencies: none
- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.11

## Possible Solutions (optional)
The doc_exists method in PgVector currently only handles null bytes but not Unicode surrogate characters. It could be improved by adding exception handling for UnicodeEncodeError

## Additional Context
none

issues.title: [Feature Request] How to create a team with agents including mcp-tooled agents
issues.body:
Hello.

Is it possible to create a team of agents with some of them been mcp-tooled ?

Does the inherent and specific mcp tools mechanism (ClientSession, StdioServerParameters, mcp.client.stdio import stdio_client) prevents the creation / execution of a hybrid (mcp tools / non mcp tools) team of agents ?

Maybe only possible through workflows ?

If not, could you provide an example on how to do that ?



Thanks a lot !
Regards
issues.author: jmtemmos

comments.author: dirkbrnd
comments.body:
Hi @jmtemmos 
No it should be perfectly possible. You can instantiate a specific member agent with the MCP tools, while the others doesn't need to have it.

issues.title: [Bug] in https://docs.agno.com/examples/workflows/startup-idea-validator "STARTUP IDEA VALIDATOR"
issues.body:
Bug Report:
   
   1. Library Version Conflict:
   - agno.tools.googlesearch is using deprecated/changed parameters
   - Affected parameters: 'num_results' (should be 'num') and 'advanced'
   
   2. Current Workaround:
   - Created CustomGoogleSearch class to bypass these issues
   - Removed 'advanced' parameter
   - Changed 'num_results' to 'num'
   
   3. Suggested Solutions:
   a) Update agno.tools.googlesearch to match current googlesearch-python API
   b) Pin googlesearch-python to a specific version (e.g., 1.0.1) that matches the tool's implementation
   c) Document the required googlesearch-python version in dependencies
   
   4. Error Messages:
   - TypeError: search() got an unexpected keyword argument 'num_results'
   - TypeError: search() got an unexpected keyword argument 'advanced'

issues.title: [Bug] Agent when using thinking model, error [cannot access local variable 'all_reasoning_steps' where it is not associated with a value]
issues.body:
# Description
Using an Agent with a reasoning_model (any native reasoning model) would raise a python error

> cannot access local variable 'all_reasoning_steps' where it is not associated with a value

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Creating an agent with a reasoning_model (can be of DeepSeek/deepseek-reasoner, Groq/deepseek, OpenAIChat/o3-..., OpenAILike/deepseek-r1 - the allowed native reasoning models list to not fall into the _use_default_reasoning_ category)
2. Run the agent

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```
rag = Agent(
        model = gemini,
        reasoning_model=deepseek,
        reasoning=True,
)
```

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
> cannot access local variable 'all_reasoning_steps' where it is not associated with a value

## Environment
- Agno Version: (e.g. v1.2.6)

## Possible Solutions (optional)
```
if reasoning_model_provided:
    ...
# If no reasoning model is provided, use the default reasoning approach
else:
    use_default_reasoning = True

if use_default_reasoning:
    ...
   all_reasoning_steps: List[ReasoningStep] = []
   ...
# Yield the final reasoning completed event
if self.stream_intermediate_steps:
    yield self.create_run_response(
        content=ReasoningSteps(reasoning_steps=all_reasoning_steps),
        content_type=ReasoningSteps.__class__.__name__,
        event=RunEvent.reasoning_completed,
    )
```
The _all_reasoning_steps_ in the final if block is out-of-scope since it is defined in the _if use_default_reasoning_ block.
possible solution: add _if self.stream_intermediate_steps_ block back into the _if use_default_reasoning_ block

## Additional Context
Add any other context or details about the problem here.

issues.title: [Feature Request]Universal Reasoning Mode Support: Extending reasoning_mode to Support All Models with think Tags
issues.body:
## Problem Description
Currently, the framework's reasoning_mode feature only supports specific models (such as deepseek and groq), which severely limits users' flexibility when choosing reasoning models. Although there are many excellent reasoning models on platforms like ollama, they cannot be utilized due to framework limitations. Most reasoning models use <think></think> tags to distinguish the reasoning process, providing a unified identification method, but the existing framework fails to fully leverage this feature.

## Proposed Solution
We propose extending the reasoning_mode functionality to a universal implementation that supports any model using <think></think> tags:
1. Modify the existing reasoning_mode implementation to identify based on tags in model output rather than model name
2. Add configuration options allowing users to specify custom reasoning tags (default to <think></think>)
3. Implement a detection mechanism to automatically identify whether reasoning tags exist in model output
4. Add specific support for Ollama models, including documentation and examples
This implementation will make the framework more flexible, allowing users to leverage any model that supports reasoning mode without being limited to specific providers.

## Alternatives Considered
Current alternatives are very limited:
1. Use already supported deepseek or groq models, giving up other models that might be more suitable for specific tasks
2. Manually process model output to extract reasoning processes, which requires additional code and processing logic
3. Modify model output format to match framework expectations, but this method is inefficient and error-prone

## Additional context
Many open-source models (such as Llama, Mistral, etc. deployed through Ollama) support reasoning process output but cannot be fully utilized in the current framework. A universal solution would allow these models to integrate seamlessly with the framework, greatly expanding the range of available models.
issues.author: CrankGentleman

comments.author: ysolanky
comments.body:
Hello @CrankGentleman !

This is a great feature request‚Äîreally appreciate the suggestion! We're getting started on it and will share an update once we make progress.

issues.title: [Bug]  print_response for reasoning Model + response Model method fails in both streaming and non-streaming modes
issues.body:
# Description
The `print_response` method has two issues:
1. In streaming mode (`stream=True`), it fails with an UnboundLocalError when trying to access the `resp` loop variable after the streaming loop completes
2. In non-streaming mode (`stream=False`), it fails to produce any response at all


## Steps to Reproduce
1. Create an Agent instance with reasoning Model + response Model.
2. Call `print_response` with `stream=True`
3. The method fails when trying to process citations after the streaming loop

This is the code used to trigger it:
```python
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.groq import Groq
from agno.models.ollama import Ollama


reasoning_thing = Agent(
    model=Ollama(id="llama3.1:8b-text-q8_0"),    
    reasoning_model=Groq(
        id="deepseek-r1-distill-llama-70b", temperature=0.6, max_tokens=1024, top_p=0.95
    ),
)

reasoning_thing.print_response("9.11 and 9.9 -- which is bigger?", stream=False)
reasoning_thing.print_response("9.11 and 9.9 -- which is bigger?", stream=True)
```


## Current Behavior
- Streaming mode: Crashes with UnboundLocalError when trying to process citations
- Non-streaming mode: Silent failure with no response

## Expected Behavior
- Streaming mode: Should properly handle responses and citations throughout and after the streaming process
- Non-streaming mode: Should produce a complete response

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "agno_playtest/reason_reason.py", line 15, in <module>
    reasoning_thing.print_response("9.11 and 9.9 -- which is bigger?", stream=True)
  File "agno_playtest/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agno/agent/agent.py", line 3805, in print_response
    if isinstance(resp, RunResponse) and resp.citations is not None and resp.citations.urls is not None:
                  ^^^^
UnboundLocalError: cannot access local variable 'resp' where it is not associated with a valu
```

## Environment
- Agno Version: 1.2.4
- External Dependency Versions:
  - ollama==0.4.7
  - groq==0.20.0
- Additional Environment Details:
  - Python 3.12.3

## Possible Solutions (optional)
Track the last received response in a separate variable throughout the streaming process, and use that for the final citations handling.

Maybe something like (agent.py  line nr:3702) for reference:
```
        if isinstance(resp, RunResponse):
            last_response = resp  # Track the last response
            if resp.event == RunEvent.run_response:

<snip>

# Use last_response instead of resp after the loop
    if (
        last_response is not None 
        and last_response.citations is not None 
        and last_response.citations.urls is not None
    ):
        md_content = "\n".join(
            f"{i + 1}. [{citation.title or citation.url}]({citation.url})"
            for i, citation in enumerate(last_response.citations.urls)
            if citation.url
        )
```
