  File "/home/xmyu/anaconda3/envs/web/lib/python3.10/site-packages/httpcore/_exceptions.py", line 14, in map_exceptions
    raise to_exc(exc) from exc
httpcore.ConnectTimeout: _ssl.c:990: The handshake operation timed out
`
## Steps to Reproduce
Set up and run Together API locally ‚Äì works fine.
Execute the following command:
python agent/agno/together.py
The request fails with a timeout error.

## Expected Behavior
The API request should complete successfully without timing out.

issues.title: [Bug] Team with mode="route" is getting into an infinite loop with tool call get_team_history

# Description
Team with mode="route" is getting into an infinite loop with tool call get_team_history

## Steps to Reproduce
send  a hi and it will loop infinitely 

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Team(
        name="xxx",
        model=azure_model,
        mode="route",
        members=[tool1,tool2,tool3],
        show_members_responses=True,
        enable_agentic_context=True,
        share_member_interactions=True,
        session_id= session_id,
        show_tool_calls=show_tool_calls,
        markdown=True,
        enable_team_history=True,
        debug_mode=agent_debug_mode,
        storage=storage,
        memory=team_memory,
        instructions = dedent("""xxx"""),
        description="""xxxx""",
        read_team_history = True,
        telemetry=False,
        user_id = user_id
    )

Should respond back with hello response

no response and gets stuck in a loop

issues.body:
# Description
I am running the test agent with Mistral small 24B (through OpenRouter, not using GPT-4o): https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/cookbook/examples/teams/coordinate/content_team.py
Here is the detailed output: https://paste.ofcode.org/EqbdC64KtXaLcEb2yVYYBr

The err is thrown at this line: https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/fbc7bdab165afa9472ae0a9ac064654b991cdee5/libs/agno/agno/models/google/gemini.py#L465

I printed the message for which the error is thrown, it looks like this:
```
Message >>>>  role='assistant' content='Okay, I will research the basics of quantum computing using the available tools.\n\n**Step 1: Define Quantum Computing**\n' name=None 
tool_call_id=None tool_calls=[{'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'duckduckgo_search', 'arguments': '{"query": "What is quantum computing definition"}'}}] audio=None images=None 
videos=None files=None audio_output=None thinking=None redacted_thinking=None provider_data=None citations=None reasoning_content=None tool_name=None tool_args=None tool_call_error=None 
stop_after_tool_call=False add_to_agent_memory=True from_history=False metrics=MessageMetrics(input_tokens=290, output_tokens=47, total_tokens=337, prompt_tokens=0, completion_tokens=0, 
prompt_tokens_details=None, completion_tokens_details=None, additional_metrics=None, time=3.2384749999910127, time_to_first_token=None, timer=<agno.utils.timer.Timer object at 0x111633f80>) 
references=None created_at=1743197361
```

## Steps to Reproduce
List the steps needed to encounter this bug or issue.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Use this: https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/cookbook/examples/teams/coordinate/content_team.py
Replace `gpt-4o` call with gemini 2.5 pro call `model=Gemini("gemini-2.5-pro-exp-03-25"),` in all three agents and then run.

Here is the test agent script:
```
import dotenv
from openai import OpenAI
dotenv.load_dotenv()

from agno.agent.agent import Agent
from agno.models.openai.chat import OpenAIChat
from agno.models.google.gemini import Gemini
from agno.models.openrouter.openrouter import OpenRouter
from agno.team.team import Team
from agno.tools.duckduckgo import DuckDuckGoTools

# Create individual specialized agents
researcher = Agent(
    name="Researcher",
    role="Expert at finding information",
    tools=[DuckDuckGoTools()],
    model=Gemini("gemini-2.5-pro-exp-03-25"),
    show_tool_calls=True
)

writer = Agent(
    name="Writer",
    role="Expert at writing clear, engaging content",
    model=Gemini("gemini-2.5-pro-exp-03-25"),
)

# Create a team with these agents
content_team = Team(
    name="Content Team",
    mode="coordinate",
    members=[researcher, writer],
    instructions="You are a team of researchers and writers that work together to create high-quality content.",
    model=Gemini("gemini-2.5-pro-exp-03-25"),
    debug_mode=True
)

# Run the team with a task
content_team.print_response("Create a short article about quantum computing")
```

## Expected Behavior
It should run fine

## Actual Behavior
Failing with err. Complete output: https://paste.ofcode.org/EqbdC64KtXaLcEb2yVYYBr

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
Include any relevant screenshots or error logs that demonstrate the issue.

issues.title: [Bug]Agent Team's SubAgent with reasoning_model doesn't output thinking part
issues.body: # Description When using an Agent Team, the reasoning_model set for a SubAgent doesn't correctly output the thinking part. Even when show_full_reasoning=True is set when calling ROUTER_AGENT, the reasoning process of the SubAgent (AFS_AGENT) is not displayed. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Create an Agent Team structure, such as the ROUTER_AGENT in the example code 2. Add a SubAgent (like AFS_AGENT) to the Team, and set a reasoning_model for that SubAgent 3. Call the run or print_response method for the main Agent (ROUTER_AGENT) with the show_full_reasoning=True parameter 4. Observe the output results and notice that the SubAgent's reasoning process is not displayed ## Agent Configuration (if applicable) ```python # Main Agent (ROUTER_AGENT) configuration ROUTER_AGENT = Agent( name="router_agent", role="Query Routing Expert", description="Responsible for understanding user query intent and routing queries to the most appropriate team member to ensure each question receives the most accurate answer", instructions=[...], team=[AFS_AGENT], markdown=True, stream=True, debug_mode=debug_mode, add_datetime_to_instructions=add_datetime_to_instructions ) # SubAgent (AFS_AGENT) configuration AFS_AGENT = Agent( name="afs_expert_agent", role="AFS Project Expert Advisor", description="An expert with comprehensive knowledge of the AFS project, capable of answering various user questions about the AFS project, providing accurate and detailed information and professional guidance", instructions=[...], model=OPENAI_MODEL, reasoning_model=GROQ_MODEL, # reasoning_model is set here markdown=True, stream=True, debug_mode=debug_mode, add_datetime_to_instructions=add_datetime_to_instructions, ) # Call method agent = ROUTER_AGENT agent.print_response("In AFS, how to check if a link has ads", stream=True, show_full_reasoning=True) ``` ## Expected Behavior When calling an Agent Team with the show_full_reasoning=True parameter, the reasoning process of the SubAgent, especially when the SubAgent has a dedicated reasoning_model set. ## Actual Behavior In reality, while the SubAgent's (AFS_AGENT) reasoning process is not shown, despite it having a dedicated reasoning_model (GROQ_MODEL) set. ## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable) ## Environment - OS: macOS - Agno Version: lts - Python Version: 3.13 ## Possible Solutions (optional) 1. Add support for SubAgent's reasoning_model in the Agent Team implementation to ensure the show_full_reasoning=True parameter is recursively applied to all SubAgents 2. Add a new parameter for Agent, such as show_team_reasoning=True, specifically to control whether to display the reasoning process of team members ## Additional Context This issue affects developers' ability to visualize and debug the thinking process of each SubAgent in an Agent Team, especially in complex scenarios using different LLM models as reasoning models. Fixing this issue is crucial for developing high-quality Agent Systems. ## Other I previously submitted an issue regarding the lack of streaming support for the thinking/reasoning part. When fixing this current issue, it would be beneficial to also incorporate streaming support for the thinking part, allowing for real-time visualization of the reasoning process across all agents in the team hierarchy. This would greatly enhance the debugging experience and provide more immediate feedback during agent development. [2264](https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/issues/2264)

Install with `pip install ollama`") _ollama_params: Dict[str, Any] = { "host": self.host, "timeout": self.timeout, } _ollama_params = {k: v for k, v in _ollama_params.items() if v is not None} if self.client_kwargs: _ollama_params.update(self.client_kwargs) self.ollama_client = OllamaClient(**_ollama_params) return self.ollama_client def _response(self, text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]: kwargs: Dict[str, Any] = {} if self.options is not None: kwargs["options"] = self.options response = self.client.embed(input=text, model=self.id, **kwargs) if response and "embeddings" in response: embeddings = response["embeddings"] if isinstance(embeddings, list) and len(embeddings) > 0 and isinstance(embeddings[0], list): return {"embeddings": embeddings[0]} elif isinstance(embeddings, list) and all(isinstance(x, (int, float)) for x in embeddings): return {"embeddings": embeddings} return {"embeddings": []} def get_embedding(self, text: str) -> List[float]: try: response = self._response(text=text) embedding = response.get("embeddings", []) if len(embedding) != self.dimensions: logger.warning(f"Expected embedding dimension {self.dimensions}, but got {len(embedding)}") return [] return embedding except Exception as e: logger.warning(e) return [] def get_embedding_and_usage(self, text: str) -> Tuple[List[float], Optional[Dict]]: embedding = self.get_embedding(text=text) usage = None return embedding, usage # issues.title: [Bug] PostgresAgentStorage auto_upgrade_schema fails to add team_session_id column when using team mode
issues.body:
# Description
The `PostgresAgentStorage` with `auto_upgrade_schema=True` and `mode="team"` fails to properly upgrade the database schema, resulting in a "column team_session_id does not exist" error when trying to insert data into the `agent_sessions` table.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Initially use the `agent_sessions` table with a non-team agent (default mode)
2. Later, switch to using team mode 
3. The agent will initialize `PostgresAgentStorage` with:
   ```python
   storage = PostgresAgentStorage(
       table_name="agent_sessions",
       db_engine=engine,
       schema="public",
       auto_upgrade_schema=True,
       mode="team"
   )
   ```
4. Try to use the team agent to process a message
5. The error occurs when trying to insert data into the existing `agent_sessions` table because it's missing the required `team_session_id` column

## Expected Behavior
The `auto_upgrade_schema=True` parameter should automatically add the required `team_session_id` column to the `agent_sessions` table when initializing the storage with `mode="team"`.

## Actual Behavior
Despite having `auto_upgrade_schema=True`, the storage fails to add the required column, resulting in a PostgreSQL error:
```
WARNING  Exception upserting into table: (psycopg2.errors.UndefinedColumn)      
         column "team_session_id" of relation "agent_sessions" does not exist
```

## Logs
```

WARNING  Exception upserting into table: (psycopg2.errors.UndefinedColumn)

         updated_at = %(param_5)s, team_id = %(param_6)s, team_session_id =     
         %(param_7)s, team_data = %(param_8)s::JSONB]                           
         [parameters: {'session_id': '1742940057.553979', 'user_id':            
         'a1004271-5a3a-40ad-98fb-7f57869acded', 'memory':                      
         '{"update_system_message_on_change": true, "create_user_memories":     
         true, "update_user_memories_after_run": true, "user_id":               
         "a1004271-5a3a-40ad-98fb-7 ... (21952 characters truncated) ... ": "A  
         friendly greeting response to the user."}, "tool_call_error": false,   
         "metrics": {"time": 0.0013079569907858968}, "created_at":              
         1742940412}]}}]}', 'session_data': '{"session_metrics":                
         {"input_tokens": 1195, "output_tokens": 33, "total_tokens": 1228,      
         "prompt_tokens": 1195, "completion_tokens": 33, "prompt_tokens_ ...    
         (141 characters truncated) ... ng_tokens": 0,                          
         "rejected_prediction_tokens": 0}, "additional_metrics": null, "time":  
         1.0890115209913347, "time_to_first_token": null, "timer": null}}',     
         'extra_data': 'null', 'team_id':                                       
         'team-c60c3921-3e63-4bf2-ac54-64b0e3f3e2ee', 'team_session_id': None,  
         'team_data': '{"name": "Team A", "team_id":

         "OpenAI", "id": "gpt-4o", "name": "OpenAICha ... (966 characters       
         truncated) ... The expected output from the agent."}},

         "expected_output"]}}}], "tool_choice": "required"}}', 'param_1':

         "a1004271-5a3a-40ad-98fb-7 ... (21952 characters truncated) ... ": "A  
         friendly greeting response to the user."}, "tool_call_error": false,   
         "metrics": {"time": 0.0013079569907858968}, "created_at":              
         1742940412}]}}]}', 'param_3': '{"session_metrics": {"input_tokens":    
         1195, "output_tokens": 33, "total_tokens": 1228, "prompt_tokens": 1195,
         "completion_tokens": 33, "prompt_tokens_ ... (141 characters truncated)
         ... ng_tokens": 0, "rejected_prediction_tokens": 0},                   
         "additional_metrics": null, "time": 1.0890115209913347,                
         "time_to_first_token": null, "timer": null}}', 'param_4': 'null',      
         'param_5': 1742940413, 'param_6':                                      
         'team-c60c3921-3e63-4bf2-ac54-64b0e3f3e2ee', 'param_7': None,          
         'param_8': '{"name": "Team A", "team_id":                      
         "team-c60c3921-3e63-4bf2-ac54-64b0e3f3e2ee", "model": {"provider":     
         "OpenAI", "id": "gpt-4o", "name": "OpenAICha ... (966 characters       
         truncated) ... The expected output from the agent."}},                 
         "additionalProperties": false, "required": ["agent_name",              
         "expected_output"]}}}], "tool_choice": "required"}}'}]                 
         (Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/20/f405)           
WARNING  A table upgrade might be required, please review these docs for more   
         information: https://agno.link/upgrade-schema         
```

## Environment
- OS: Linux 6.13.7 (OrbStack)
- Python Version: 3.11
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Agno Version: 1.2.4

## Possible Solutions
The schema upgrade logic might need to be fixed to properly handle team mode columns

## Additional Context
We want to use the same `agent_sessions` table for both team and non-team agents to maintain a unified session history. Is this approach supported?

issues.title: [Bug] Agent Tool Call Fails with 'Missing Required Parameter' Error
issues.body:
I wasn't able to comment on or reopen #2424 , but the issue was marked as closed when it is still an active bug. The reason it's a bug is:
1. This behavior is not documented
2. There is not sufficient error handling for tools that don't return strings.

But the issues could very easily be solved with some simple type checking on agno's side. If the result of the tool call is anything other than a string, dump it to a string. Is there any reason why it's not implemented this way?
issues.author: SethTurin

comments.author: ysolanky
comments.body: Hello @SethTurin ! Sorry about that! I think that this is a valuable addition to the framework and something we should have documented on our docs. I am noting it down as a feature request and I agree with you, we can add type checking to make sure the tools return a string.

comments.author: SethTurin
comments.body:
Thanks! And for what it's worth, this quirk aside, I just started working
with agno and it is so far the best agent framework I've ever used. Great
work!

issues.title: [Bug] Team doesn't work with Ollama
issues.body:
# Description
Team class doesn't work with Ollama models. The error returned is `TypeError: Client.chat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'tool_choice'`

## Steps to Reproduce
Run this code:

```
from agno.agent.agent import Agent
from agno.team.team import Team
from agno.models.ollama.chat import Ollama

echo_agent = Agent(
    model=Ollama(id="qwen2.5:32b"),
    instructions=["Always respond with 'Hello world!!!'"]
)
hello_world_team = Team(
    model=Ollama(id="qwen2.5:32b"),
    members=[echo_agent],
    mode="coordinate",
)

hello_world_team.print_response("Hello?")
```

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)


## Expected Behavior
Team executes

## Actual Behavior
Error `TypeError: Client.chat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'tool_choice'` when running the team. However, single agents work.


## Environment
- OS: macOS
- Agno Version: 1.1.15
issues.author: gorootde

issues.title: [Bug]Gemini message role with function response may be incorrect
issues.body:
# Description
Noticed a discrepancy in the way roles are used in messages for the gemini model

## Steps to Reproduce
Calling a simple function in the python-genai library the roles are always model/user as per the sdk
https://googleapis.github.io/python-genai/genai.html#genai.types.Content.role

    field role: Optional[str] = None

    Optional. The producer of the content. Must be either ‚Äòuser‚Äô or ‚Äòmodel‚Äô. Useful to set for multi-turn conversations, otherwise can be left blank or unset. If role is not specified, SDK will determine the role.

```
def day_of_week() -> str:
    """Get the current day of the week.
    Example:
        {{time.dayOfWeek}} => Sunday
    """
    now = datetime.datetime.now()
    return now.strftime("%A")

    model="gemini-2.0-flash-exp",
    contents="What day is it today?",
    config=types.GenerateContentConfig(
        tools=[day_of_week,],
    ),
)

However in agno the messages with tools have the role as 'tool'

```
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.google import Gemini
from google.genai import types
import google.auth
import datetime
from rich import pretty

credentials, PROJECT_ID = google.auth.default()
GEMINI_PRO = "gemini-1.5-pro"
GEMINI_FLASH = "gemini-1.5-flash"
LOCATION = "us-central1"

generation_config = types.GenerateContentConfig(
    temperature=0,
    top_p=0.1,
    top_k=1,
    max_output_tokens=4096,
)

safety_settings = [
    types.SafetySetting(
        category=types.HarmCategory.HARM_CATEGORY_UNSPECIFIED,
        threshold=types.HarmBlockThreshold.BLOCK_ONLY_HIGH,
    ),
    types.SafetySetting(
        category=types.HarmCategory.HARM_CATEGORY_DANGEROUS_CONTENT,
        threshold=types.HarmBlockThreshold.BLOCK_ONLY_HIGH,
    ),
    types.SafetySetting(

        threshold=types.HarmBlockThreshold.BLOCK_ONLY_HIGH,
    ),
    types.SafetySetting(

        threshold=types.HarmBlockThreshold.BLOCK_ONLY_HIGH,
    ),
    types.SafetySetting(
        category=types.HarmCategory.HARM_CATEGORY_SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT,
        threshold=types.HarmBlockThreshold.BLOCK_ONLY_HIGH,
    ),
]

model_choice = Gemini(
    id=GEMINI_PRO,
    vertexai=True,
    project_id=PROJECT_ID,
    location=LOCATION,
    generation_config=generation_config,
    safety_settings=safety_settings,
)

def day_of_week() -> str:
    """Get the current day of the week.
    Example:
        {{time.dayOfWeek}} => Sunday
    """
    now = datetime.datetime.now()
    return now.strftime("%A")

agent = Agent(
    model=model_choice,
    tools=[
       day_of_week
    ],
    markdown=True,
    show_tool_calls=True,

)
response=agent.run("What day is it")
pretty.pprint(response)

```

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
As above

## Expected Behavior
I would expect role to follow the gemini spec and be either user or model

## Actual Behavior
In testing, I got an error from gemini complaining about an invalid role. I didn't have message logging enabled and could not capture the set of actual messages.

## Environment
- Agno Version: v1.1.8
- Additional Environment Details: gemini via vertex

## Possible Solutions (optional)
I've taken a look at the gemini code, but cannot determine if 'role' is sent as 'tool' to gemini, but would encourage an audit to ensure it does not receive an inappropriate role
issues.author: jeffbryner

comments.author: ysolanky
comments.body: Hello @jeffbryner ! You are correct, we are using role=tool for function call results. And I also agree that we should be following the Gemini spec for the same. Can you please help me replicate the error that you observed?

comments.author: jeffbryner
comments.body:
It has been hard to duplicate.

I was able to capture a sample message series before it went to gemini with an errant role type by adding this to here https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/models/google/gemini.py#L365
```
logger.info(f"Starting Gemini API stream with MESSAGES {fo

comments.author: ysolanky
comments.body: Hey @jeffbryner ! Yes, looks like currently Gemini does not throw an error with role set to tool. But regardless, we should not be using the "tool" role as it not officially supported. I am going to update the model class. Thanks for this catch! We really appreciate it

comments.author: msaadg
comments.body: Hey @ysolanky if there's not much progress, can I have a go at this? Happy to be assigned this issue!

issues.title: [Feature Request] Cookbooks for search types
issues.body:
## Problem Description
Create cookbooks to demonstrate use of different `search_type` for PgVector 

## Proposed Solution
In the `cookbook/agent_concepts/knowledge` directory create a new folder `search_type` and populate it with different `search_type` examples using PgVector

[Docs on how to get started
](https://docs.agno.com/vectordb/pgvector)
issues.author: ysolanky

comments.author: lakshdhamija
comments.body: Hey @ysolanky can I work on this?

issues.title: [Bug] TypeError: Client.chat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'tool_choice'
issues.body:
agno==1.2.3
ollama==0.4.7

I am getting the below while using team using Ollama engine run models. I am not sure what changes to be done here to fix this. Need help.

`**TypeError: Client.chat() got an unexpected keyword argument 'tool_choice'**`

**Mocked code:**

```
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.ollama import Ollama
from agno.team import Team

foo = Agent(
    name="foo",
    role="testing",
    model=Ollama(

issues.title: Cached Google/DDG-Search to reduce rate limit penalty
issues.body:
## Problem Description
When I try to run an example invoking search, I get hit by DDG and google by a rate limit penalty. Example: 
_cookbook/workflows/mistral_workflows/blog_post_generator.py_
During developement and experimental time, I will run the query about cats and their domination multiple times.  Actually, the blog post example expects the web search and the agent to fail and retries 3 times. When (not if) the web search works fine, but the subsequent json is malformed, DDG will hit its rate limit. Google follows some time later, but still I grind to a halt. 

## Proposed Solution
Similar to the blog post-cache in the same blog_post_generator, we can provide a CachedGoogleSearchTools. It will store the queries and replies in a cache. This will make developement and reproduction of issues easier.

## Alternatives Considered

- I already switched from DuckDuckGo to the Google search, as DDG hits the rate limit pretty early. 
- We could also use mocks for testing, but during developement, I would like to see a realistic example. 
- Another possibility is a cooldown time. 
- I am not sure, if this is suitable in a real usage - I would expect to run different, not cached queries.

## Additional context
Include any extra information that might be helpful, such as:
- Examples of similar features elsewhere: I adapted the cache from cookbook/workflows/mistral_workflows/blog_post_generator.py 

## Would you like to work on this?
We welcome contributions! Let us know if you‚Äôd like to help implement this feature.
**[x ] Yes, I‚Äôd love to work on it!** - I actually have a solution that "works for me"
**[ ] I‚Äôm open to collaborating but need guidance.**
**[ ] No, I‚Äôm just sharing the idea.**

issues.title: [Bug] Team agent loses context across REST API calls despite consistent session_id and user_id
issues.body:
# Description
When using the Team agent with enable_team_history=True, the system correctly preserves and recalls previous context in a console (stateful) session. However, when using the exact same setup via REST API, the agent loses all context across messages ‚Äî even though the same session_id and user_id are passed in both cases.

This issue breaks the experience entirely in web-based or stateless deployments.


## Steps to Reproduce
1. Initialize a Team agent using multiple sub-agents with storage enabled:

```
self.storage = PostgresStorage(
    table_name="agent_chats",
    db_url=os.getenv("AGENT_DB_URL"),
    auto_upgrade_schema=True
)
```
2. Set enable_team_history=True and pass session_id and user_id.
3. Run a multi-turn conversation using the console app ‚Äî works perfectly and recalls context.
4. Do the same via REST API, passing the same session_id and user_id.
5. Observe that the second and subsequent calls fail to preserve any memory or context.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```
agent = Team(
    name="Orchestrator",
    members=[appointment_agent, calories_agent, summary_agent, companion_agent],
    model=model,
    mode="route",
    instructions=[
        "Route messages to the correct agent.",
        "Only use the Welcome agent for greetings or unclear tasks.",
        "Avoid direct responses ‚Äî always route.",
        "Respond in the user‚Äôs language (Arabic or English)."
    ],
    enable_team_history=True,
    num_of_interactions_from_history=5,
    add_datetime_to_instructions=True,
    markdown=True,
)
```
All sub-agents are initialized with storage using PostgresStorage.


## Expected Behavior
Subsequent requests via REST API should retain session context and history as they do in the console version ‚Äî allowing seamless multi-turn conversations.

## Actual Behavior
Every REST request is treated as a new conversation with no prior memory, even with the same session_id and user_id.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
Include any relevant screenshots or error logs that demonstrate the issue.

## Environment

- OS: Ubuntu 22.04 (local + containerized environments)
- Agno Version: 1.1.15
- Storage: Postgres via PostgresStorage
- API Platform: FastAPI
- Model: OpenAILike, Llama 3, using OpenAI-compatible wrapper
- Other: Session ID and User ID are explicitly passed and consistent

## Possible Solutions (optional)

- Ensure Team agent can persist and retrieve memory across REST calls using session_id as expected.
- Allow user-defined context resolvers for team mode if not yet supported.
- Confirm that internal agent histories are merged or accessible to Team.


## Additional Context
This is a critical issue for real deployments ‚Äî our production setup relies on REST APIs, not console mode. Without persistent context in API mode, the Team orchestration agent becomes unusable for multi-turn interactions.

Appreciate your urgent feedback and guidance.

Thank you! üôè
issues.author: kasem-io

comments.author: dirkbrnd
comments.body: @kasem-io this should be resolved with the latest version `1.2.3`

issues.title: [Bug] User memory imported to session memory
issues.body:
# Description
There is the concept of storage and the concept of memory. There appears to be an unintended overlap between them which pulls user memories into session storage even if the conversation or tasks are unrelated.

## Steps to Reproduce
Create an agent using storage and memory with multiple chat sessions. 
If a session results in 'user' memory being updated that update will be pulled into sessions as 'session memory'.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```
agent = Agent(
    telemetry=False,
    user_id="0x7eff@jeffbryner.com",
    model=Gemini(
        id=model,
        generation_config=generation_config,
        safety_settings=safety_settings,
        system_prompt=system_prompt,
    ),
    storage=FirestoreAgentStorage(
        collection_name="agent_sessions",
    ),
    # Store memories in Firestore, options off
    memory=AgentMemory(
        db=FirestoreMemoryDb(),
        create_user_memories=True,
        create_session_summary=True,
        update_user_memories_after_run=True,
        update_session_summary_after_run=True,
        classifier=MemoryClassifier(model=Gemini(id="gemini-1.5-pro")),
        summarizer=MemorySummarizer(model=Gemini(id="gemini-1.5-pro")),
        manager=MemoryManager(model=Gemini(id="gemini-1.5-pro")),
    ),
    # Set add_history_to_messages=true to add the previous chat history to the messages sent to the Model.
    add_history_to_messages=True,
    # Number of historical responses to add to the messages.
    num_history_responses=10,
    create_default_user_message=False,
    retries=3,
    instructions=system_prompt,
    markdown=True,
)
```

## Expected Behavior
I expected the user memory store to updated with key facts about the user (name, interests, etc) and the session memory store to remain relevant to the session. 

## Actual Behavior
The user memory store was updated according to a conversation in a session. That session included the memories. 
When starting another conversation in a different session, the memories from the user were imported into this session but we not relevant. 

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
### User memory after a conversation about beer:
![User memory storing facts](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f692f353-13fa-4707-a5d0-385154fe9b29)

### Session data object after the same conversation:
![Session data object for a conversation about beer](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/344c868f-943e-470d-87c5-4d7f2db223d8)

### Session data after a subsequent conversation about whiskey:
![Session data object for a conversation about whiskey](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/91acc95f-616a-49b2-a9cc-5babc294ea23)

## Environment
- OS: (container: python3.10-slim)
- External Dependency Versions: (firestore storage PRs https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/pull/1978 https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/pull/1977)
- Additional Environment Details: (Python 3.10 in cloudrun)

## Possible Solutions (optional)
I believe this is happening due to the agent.get_agent_session pulling in memories from the user memory store
https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/agent/agent.py#L1453

'Memory' is stored and retrieved by user id. https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/memory/db/mongodb.py#L71
'Session' storage is by session ID and user idbut due to the call above in get_agent_session it imports user memories. https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/storage/agent/mongodb.py#L61

Later when the agent saves it's information to storage, this is used as 'memories' in the session data object. 

Could there be a flag to not store user memory in the session? This would make it clear that they are only related to the user and not the session.
Could there be a better prompt for user memory such that it is less about the conversation and more about the facts (name, likes, etc)? This way it would be less likely to influence the session conversation.

## Additional Context
This could lead to confusing inferences from the model if it stores data in one context, but uses it in another session inappropriately.

Write a haiku about the current weather.", markdown=True, stream=True, ) agent.print_response("The sun is shining", stream=True) ``` ## Agent Configuration (if applicable) Provide relevant agent configuration. ## Expected Behavior ## Actual Behavior ## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable) Include any relevant screenshots or error logs that demonstrate the issue. ## Environment - OS: macOS 15.3 - Browser (if relevant): N/A - Agno Version: v1.1.6 - External Dependency Versions: boto3==1.37.0 - Additional Environment Details: Python 3.12 ## Possible Solutions (optional) I have tested adding `aws_session_token` param to client_params and it worked, then I realized that Claude class doesn't support session token at all. issues.title: Support for Gemini File API
issues.body:
As far as I can tell, there is not yet support for the Gemini File API. 

I noticed the latest 1.1.11 changes that added the File type to Gemini and Anthropic models support direct url downloads, which is insufficient for the file URI object that the Gemini File API returns.

Gemini File API reference: https://ai.google.dev/api/files#example-request
Gemini File API cookbook from Google: https://github.com/google-gemini/cookbook/blob/main/quickstarts/file-api/sample.py

The Gemini File API is hugely useful for large volumes of PDF, and images and videos too. 

Is Gemini File API support part of the roadmap?

Thank you

issues.title: [Bug] Can not use Azure OpenAI to create an agent
issues.body:
# Description
I am using agno version `1.1.15` and when trying to use a simple agent using Azure OpenAI I am getting this error:
```
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'anthropic'
```

## Steps to Reproduce
Create a simple agent like this:
```python
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.azure import AzureOpenAI

model = AzureOpenAI(
    id="gpt-4o-mini",
    api_key="...",
    api_version="...",
    azure_endpoint="...",
    azure_deployment="gpt-4o-mini",
)

agent = Agent(
    model=model,
    description="You are an enthusiastic news reporter with a flair for storytelling!",
    markdown=True
)
agent.print_response("Tell me about a breaking news story from New York.", stream=True)
```
If you try to run it you get the error above.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
Please check the steps to reproduce

## Expected Behavior
If I have all the necessary credentials for Azure OpenAI I should be able to use it just like any other model.

## Actual Behavior
The sample code fails with module not found error and for whatever reason it mentions Antropic.

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
Include any relevant screenshots or error logs that demonstrate the issue.

## Environment
- OS: Mac OS
- Agno Version: 1.1.15
- External Dependency Versions: None
- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.10

## Possible Solutions (optional)
I have investigated the issue and I think there are two issues here:
- We should probably remove the reference to `AzureAIFoundry` from here: https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/models/azure/__init__.py#L1. Otherwise we force users to install Azure AI Foundry dependencies for no good reason, while they are interested in Azure OpenAI chat
- We should remove the reference to Anthropic from here: https://github.com/agno-agi/agno/blob/main/libs/agno/agno/models/azure/ai_foundry.py#L7. It should be an easy fix, but it is not clear how `BaseModel` should be used or if there is  need for a more sophisticated fix.

## Additional Context
Add any other context or details about the problem here.
issues.author: artur-ciocanu

comments.author: artur-ciocanu
comments.body: The issue has been fixed in PR #2492

issues.title: [Bug]CombinedKnowledgeBase(contain WebsiteKnowledgeBase ) does not update when agent use WebsiteTools
issues.body:
# Description
CombinedKnowledgeBase(contain WebsiteKnowledgeBase ) does not update when agent use WebsiteTools

## Steps to Reproduce
When use WebsiteTools to update WebsiteKnowledgeBase (e.g., Search web page :'http://'), CombinedKnowledgeBase does not automatically reflect the changes. The combined_documents table remains outdated, while website_documents is updated.

## Agent Configuration (if applicable)
```
knowledge_base = CombinedKnowledgeBase(
    sources=[
        url_pdf_knowledge_base,
        website_knowledge_base,
        local_pdf_knowledge_base,
    ],
    vector_db=PgVector(
        table_name="combined_documents",
        db_url=db_url,
        search_type=SearchType.hybrid,
        embedder=embedder,
    ),
)
implement_agent = Agent(
    model=model,
    tools=[ WebsiteTools(knowledge_base=website_knowledge_base),
    ],
)
```

## Expected Behavior
Synchronous update

## Actual Behavior
CombinedKnowledgeBase does not update when agent use WebsiteTools

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)


## Environment
- Agno Version: (1.1.13)

## Possible Solutions (optional)

```
import json
from typing import List, Optional

from agno.document import Document
from agno.knowledge.website import WebsiteKnowledgeBase
from agno.knowledge.combined import CombinedKnowledgeBase  #  # New import
from agno.tools import Toolkit
from agno.utils.log import logger


class WebsiteTools(Toolkit):
    def __init__(
        self,
        knowledge_base: Optional[WebsiteKnowledgeBase] = None,
        combined_knowledge_base: Optional[CombinedKnowledgeBase] = None,  # New arg
    ):
        super().__init__(name="website_tools")
        self.knowledge_base: Optional[WebsiteKnowledgeBase] = knowledge_base
        self.combined_knowledge_base: Optional[CombinedKnowledgeBase] = combined_knowledge_base  # New arg

        if self.knowledge_base is not None and isinstance(self.knowledge_base, WebsiteKnowledgeBase):
            self.register(self.add_website_to_knowledge_base)
        else:
            self.register(self.read_url)

    def add_website_to_knowledge_base(self, url: str) -> str:
        """This function adds a website's content to the knowledge base.
        NOTE: The website must start with https:// and should be a valid website.

        USE THIS FUNCTION TO GET INFORMATION ABOUT PRODUCTS FROM THE INTERNET.

        :param url: The URL of the website to add.
        :return: 'Success' if the website was added to the knowledge base.
        """
        if self.knowledge_base is None:
            return "Knowledge base not provided"

        logger.debug(f"Adding to knowledge base: {url}")
        self.knowledge_base.urls.append(url)

        logger.debug("Loading website knowledge base.")
        self.knowledge_base.load(recreate=False)

        # if configure CombinedKnowledgeBase
        if self.combined_knowledge_base is not None:
            logger.debug("Updating combined knowledge base after website update.")
            self.combined_knowledge_base.load(recreate=True)  

        return "Success"

    def read_url(self, url: str) -> str:
        """This function reads a URL and returns the content.

        :param url: The URL of the website to read.
        :return: Relevant documents from the website.
        """
        from agno.document.reader.website_reader import WebsiteReader

        website = WebsiteReader()

        logger.debug(f"Reading website: {url}")
        relevant_docs: List[Document] = website.read(url=url)
        return json.dumps([doc.to_dict() for doc in relevant_docs])

```

## Additional Context
Thank you for the great work on this projrct! Looking forward to a fix or claeification

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add support for OpenSearch as a Vector Database
issues.body:
## Problem Description
I often find it frustrating when I cannot use OpenSearch as a vector database in Agno because it limits my ability to leverage OpenSearch's robust search and analytics capabilities for handling vector data.

## Proposed Solution
Integrate OpenSearch as a vector database option within Agno. This feature should allow users to store and query vector data using OpenSearch seamlessly. Ensure compatibility with existing features such as memory management, knowledge stores, and multi-agent support. Provide comprehensive documentation and examples to help users get started with OpenSearch.

I have considered using other vector databases supported by Agno, but they do not offer the same level of performance and scalability as OpenSearch. Additionally, using a different vector database would require significant changes to my existing infrastructure, which is already optimized for OpenSearch.

I‚Äôm open to collaborating but need guidance on what functions are needed and how they will be integrated with agents.
issues.author: sushantgundla7

comments.author: ashpreetbedi
comments.body: Thank you @sushantgundla7, agree we should support opensearch! would you be open to working with us to add it as a vector store?

comments.author: ashpreetbedi
comments.body: Since you're a heavy user, it would be great to get your expertise as well

comments.author: Dev79844
comments.body:
Hey @sushantgundla7,
I would like to collaborate on this issue.

comments.author: sushantgundla7
Dev79844
comments.body: I will push the basic code for the opensearch wrapper and leave few function signatures which you can implement. Also refer to the implementation of other vectordbs in the codebase, you will get an idea on how vectordbs are integrated.

# Description
i tried to use Ollama qwen7b model for a basic task. It is working fine when I use Ollama backend in Agno. 
Hoowever when I dddo the same thing with LiiteLLM it fails. This generally happens when I use tools. 

## Steps to Reproduce
Here is a basic chatbot implementation of LiteLLM using OpenAILike

## This is my code:
```
"""ü§ñ Basic Chatbot Workflow - Simple Conversational Agent

This implements a basic chatbot using the Agno framework:

1. Handles continuous conversation
2. Maintains conversation history
3. Uses local model via OpenAILike
4. Simple error handling

Run with:
python cookbook/workflows/testChat.py
"""

from typing import Iterator
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.workflow import Workflow, RunResponse
from agno.models.openai.like import OpenAILike
from agno.tools.duckduckgo import DuckDuckGoTools
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from agno.models.ollama import Ollama
from agno.models.openai import OpenAIChat

load_dotenv()

class ChatbotWorkflow(Workflow):
    """Basic conversational chatbot workflow"""
    
    description: str = "Simple chatbot for casual conversation"
    
    chat_agent: Agent = Agent(
        model=OpenAILike(
            id="ollama/qwen2.5:7b-instruct",
            base_url="http://0.0.0.0:4000",
        ),
        # model=Ollama(id="qwen2.5:1.5b"),
        # model=OpenAIChat(id="gpt-4o-mini", temperature=0.1), 
        description="Friendly Conversational Assistant",
        # tools=[DuckDuckGoTools()],
        instructions=[
            "You are a friendly chatbot named Clippy",
            "Prioritize answering from your own knowledge for general questions",
            "Only use web search when:",
            "- Asked about current events/news",
            "- Question requires real-time data (sports scores, stock prices, etc)",
            "- Explicitly asked to look up information",
            "- Unsure of the answer to factual questions",
            "When searching:",
            "1. Perform focused DuckDuckGo search",
            "2. Extract key facts",
            "3. Summarize findings concisely",
            "4. Always maintain conversational tone",
            "Keep responses under 3 sentences unless complex topic",
            "Acknowledge if info comes from web search",
            "Maintain context across messages",
            "Ask clarifying questions if request is ambiguous"
        ],
        add_datetime_to_instructions=True,
        # search_knowledge=False,
        # add_references=True,
        markdown=True,
    )

    def run(self, initial_message: str = None) -> Iterator[RunResponse]:
        print("Chatbot initialized. Type 'exit' to end the conversation.\n")
        
        while True:
            try:
                user_input = input("You: ")
                if user_input.lower() in ['exit', 'quit']:
                    break
                
                response = self.chat_agent.run(user_input)
                print(f"\nBot: {response.content}\n")
                
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"Error: {str(e)}")
                break

        yield RunResponse(content="Conversation ended", event="complete")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    bot = ChatbotWorkflow()
    list(bot.run())  # Start the conversation

```

Bot: Hi there! How can I help you today? üòä

comments.author: dirkbrnd
comments.body:
Hi @alaap001 
We don't officially support LiteLLM, and we have the Ollama model class because Ollama also doesn't exactly mirror the OpenAI interface. Especially with tool calling. I can only recommend that you use the Ollama backend if that is possible for you.

issues.title: [Bug] Doubao LLM for running the agent team demo
issues.body:
# Description

When replacing the LLM models with Doubao, an error occurs.
However, it runs well when using the Phidata.

Doubao llm is created by `from agno.models.openai.like import OpenAILike`.

## Error
```
openai.BadRequestError: Error code: 400 - {'error': {'code': 'InvalidParameter', 'message': 'One or more parameters specified in the request are not valid. Request id: 02173850780234684bae976ab37fc49f95f8882bb751870475bb0', 'param': '', 'type': 'BadRequest'}}
```

## Steps to Reproduce
### code
```
from agno.agent import Agent
from agno.models.openai import OpenAIChat
from agno.tools.hackernews import HackerNewsTools
from agno.tools.duckduckgo import DuckDuckGoTools
from agno.tools.newspaper4k import Newspaper4kTools
from LLMPool.LLMManager import LLMModelManager

hn_researcher = Agent(
    name="HackerNews Researcher",
    model=LLMModelManager().get_llm_model("doubao"),
    role="Gets top stories from hackernews.",
    tools=[HackerNewsTools()],
)

web_searcher = Agent(
    name="Web Searcher",
    model=LLMModelManager().get_llm_model("doubao"),
    role="Searches the web for information on a topic",
    tools=[DuckDuckGoTools()],
    add_datetime_to_instructions=True,
)

article_reader = Agent(
    name="Article Reader",
    model=LLMModelManager().get_llm_model("doubao"),
    role="Reads articles from URLs.",
    tools=[Newspaper4kTools()],
)

hn_team = Agent(
    name="Hackernews Team",
    model=LLMModelManager().get_llm_model("doubao"),
    team=[hn_researcher, web_searcher, article_reader],
    instructions=[
        "First, search hackernews for what the user is asking about.",
        "Then, ask the article reader to read the links for the stories to get more information.",
        "Important: you must provide the article reader with the links to read.",
        "Then, ask the web searcher to search for each story to get more information.",
        "Finally, provide a thoughtful and engaging summary.",
    ],
    show_tool_calls=True,
    markdown=True,
)
hn_team.print_response("Write an article about the top 2 stories on hackernews", stream=False)
```

issues.title: [Bug] AgentMemory: OPENAI_API_KEY not set. Please set the OPENAI_API_KEY environment variable.
issues.body:
# Description
I'm trying to use a simple agent with AgentMemory but it always throws "OPENAI_API_KEY not set. Please set the OPENAI_API_KEY environment variable." even if I set the MemoryClassifier and its api_key

## Steps to Reproduce
```
model = OpenAIChat(
    id="openai/gpt-4o",
    api_key="myapikey",
    base_url="https://openrouter.ai/api/v1/"
)

a = Agent(
    model=model,
    memory=AgentMemory(
        create_user_memories=True,
        db=PgMemoryDb(
            table_name="agent_memory",
            schema="public",
            db_url="postgresql+psycopg://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/my_agents"
        ),
        classifier=MemoryClassifier(
            model=model
        )
    )
)

full_response = ""

run_response = await a.arun(
    message="Hi! My name is jonh",
    stream=True
)

async for chunk in run_response:
    if chunk.content is not None:
        full_response += chunk.content
        yield chunk.content
```

## Expected Behavior
Should not throws exception, since the MemoryClassifier instance has the model property with api_key settled

## Actual Behavior
It throws exception even if I set the API Key on the MemoryClassifier model

## Environment
- OS: macOS
- Agno Version: 1.1.14
- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.13

## Additional Context
The agent works if I set create_user_memories=False, it's something on AgentMemory
issues.author: alexandrereyes

comments.author: alexandrereyes
comments.body: I was missing the MemoryManager.

issues.title: [Bug] Agent Tool Call Fails with 'Missing Required Parameter' Error
issues.body:
# Description
I have created an agent that includes a tool for making HTTPS requests to a public F1 API. Below is the tool definition:
```
@tool(name="get_driver_info", description="Get information about a F1 driver")
def get_driver_info(driver_number: int):
    """Get information about a F1 driver."""
    return F1API.get_driver_info(driver_number)
```

The tool is then passed to the agent as follows:

```
agent = Agent(
            model=self.model,
            tools=[get_driver_info],
            ...
        )
```

The agent correctly identifies the need for a tool call and executes it. However, I encounter the following error:

```
raise ModelProviderError(
agno.exceptions.ModelProviderError: Missing required parameter: 'messages[3].content[0].type'.
```

Notably, the API being called is functioning correctly, so the issue is not with the API itself. I have tested the tool both with and without the @ tool decorator, but the error persists.

## Expected Behavior
The agent should:

- Recognize the tool
- Execute the tool call
- Return the tool call result successfully

## Actual Behavior

Instead, the following error occurs:
```
raise ModelProviderError(
agno.exceptions.ModelProviderError: Missing required parameter: 'messages[3].content[0].type'.
```

## Environment
- Agno Version: lastest
issues.author: martimfasantos

issues.title: [Bug] Toolkits error out with new type annotation scheme
issues.body:
# Description
There's a _newish_ syntax for type annotating unions (with `|` instead of `Union`) which are supported officially (and recommended) by Python 3.10 onwards.

However, their type is currently returned as `types.UnionType`, which doesn't match `Union`, and thus fail converting the tool params to JSON schema.

PR #2379 fixes this issue (and a few others I identified, described in the PR).

issues.title: [Bug] Multi User Setup - Data Security Issues
issues.body:
We need to have the user_id in a toolkit function in order to get the right data when a user calls an agent.
We have a multi-user setup for agent system to handle permissions and data access.
So basically we create one agent per user:



### main function
```
# Cache to store agent instances
_agent_cache = {}

def get_agent_for_user(user: User):
    # Check if agent exists in cache
    if user.id in _agent_cache:
        return _agent_cache[user.id]

    # Create toolkit instances with user metadata
    personal_toolkit = PersonalTools()
    # Create new agent
    agent = Agent(
        session_id=session_id,
        user_id=user_id,
        tools=[personal_toolkit]
    )

    # Cache the agent instance
    _agent_cache[user.id] = agent
    
    return agent

```

### toolkit
```
class PersonalToolkit(Toolkit)
...
  async def get_personal_data(self,  agent: Agent) -> str:
     user_id = agent.user_id
      # performs db lookup for the data with the user_id
     return personal_data
...
```




But we are facing issues with that topic: A multi user setup is not document and it seems like not supported as a first class citizen. We did find the agent parameter in the toolkit only by looking at the code.

We are now facing the issue, that when we have many users, **we get the wrong user ids** by the agent.

This caused us **significant data privacy leaks and security issues**.

How can we develop a secure multi user setup using your framework?

issues.title: Enhanced PDF Extraction: Improved Support for Images, Tables, and Figures
issues.body:
**Problem Description:**  
Our current PDF extraction functionality is limited to basic text extraction. The custom extractor in place struggles with advanced elements‚Äînamely images, tables, and figures‚Äîbecause it relies on a proprietary vector-based scheme. This limitation not only prevents proper extraction of these graphic elements but also affects downstream processes, especially in workflows that depend on contextual data extraction (e.g., Retrieval-Augmented Generation, or RAG).

**Proposed Solution:**  
- Integrate support for robust libraries, such as *PyMuPDF* or *PyMuPDFLLM*, which natively handle image, table, and figure extraction from PDFs.  
- Ensure that any new extraction module maintains compatibility with existing vector-based search capabilities and allows for seamless incorporation into RAG workflows.  
- Consider extending support to include additional frameworks (e.g., KAG) that could further enhance data retrieval and processing capabilities.  

**Participation Statement:**  
I am sharing this idea to address a common pain point with current PDF extraction tools. Although I currently do not have the technical capacity to implement these changes, I believe this proposal could serve as a solid foundation for further development.
issues.author: RelightEvasion

issues.title: [Bug] `ag ws create` command still create some of the files with `phi` lib reference
issues.body:
# Description
Created the workspace using `ag ws create` command. It created the workspace but there are some files that refer to `phi` package in place of `agno`, so when I run `ag ws up dev`, it fails with errors saying `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'phi'`

## Steps to Reproduce
In blank project (where agno package is already installed), run `ag ws create` and then run `ag ws up dev` command.

## Expected Behavior
`ag ws up dev` should run successfully and there should not be any reference to `phi` in created workspace.

## Actual Behavior
After creating the fresh workspace in new project, `ag ws up dev` command fails with error `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'phi'`, as there are some files that refer to older package name `phi`

## Screenshots or Logs (if applicable)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50fa88e3-1c3a-4cd0-90b4-b6df88ec5474)

## Environment
- OS: mac
- Browser (if relevant): Chrome
- Agno Version: 1.1.7
- Additional Environment Details: Python 3.12.4

## Possible Solutions (optional)
No file in freshly created workspace should refer `phi` package.
issues.author: gauravdhiman

comments.author: gauravdhiman
comments.body: Even `requirements.txt` is installing `phidata==2.5.3` and not `agno`, `agno-aws` and `agno-docker` packages.

issues.title: [Bug] `AgentMemory.get_message_pairs()` returns repeated messages when `Agent.add_history_to_messages = True`
issues.body:
Hi,
I found this bug which effects the summarizer results.

When using `AgentMemory.summarizer()`, it uses `AgentMemory.get_message_pairs()`, but when the `Agent.add_history_to_messages = True`, The messages in each `RunResponse` are updated whith history.
So the result of  the `get_message_pairs` is the first two messages of the history!
So  in `get_message_pairs`  the condition `message.from_history == False` must be added to each for loop I guess.
issues.author: mehrzadai
